Job Description: First Orion is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join a leading mobile software vendor in the Data Solutions Group. This is a dynamic and diverse role requiring extensive analytical, data product and business skills applied through the execution of data including development and creation of data content for use in data products and solutions. These activities are typically product or solution based designed for use by many clients or the focus of a single client who requires custom research and data development to solve a specific business problem. What you'll be doing: Use data science tools and techniques to perform varied analyses to support business requirements, including scoring and predictive models, classification, data mining, clustering, and NLP techniques Implement data exploration to discover patterns, build new features for machine learning models, uncover gaps in the solution(s), and identify anomalies within the data warehouse(s) Generate visualizations using Scala/Python/SQL and create storyboards to communicate data insights, significant features, and model performance Build, own, and maintain Tableau and SQL dashboards for internal reporting and external, client-facing users Compile and prepare data from various sources by creating and managing ETL systems, Delta tables, and Databricks jobs for analyses and internal reporting Capture critical changes in production processes, manage data-driven alerts, and communicate findings with data engineering and data science teams Utilize Git for version control to manage own projects and collaborate with data engineers and data scientists Create metadata, data dictionaries, and Confluence pages for technical documentation Lead escalation analyses and prepare written reports for intra and inter-team senior management Assist in defining new data products or solutions for future business opportunities Use Agile/Scrum methodology for project planning and development What you'll need: Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, or Economics (strong econometrics focus) Experience in working with large datasets Programming experience in a language of your choice (Scala/Python/R preferred) High curiosity for data discovery Ability to perform verbal and visual storytelling with data Self-starter able to work independently with limited supervision. Strong verbal and written communication skills Bonus Points: Prior experience in the telecommunications industry Amazon Web Services experience Spark experience Knowledge about big data platforms Company Benefits: Balancing the work-life flow is key to health and happiness! That is why we offer one of the most competitive packages in our industry with open PTO, company paid holidays, Flex Fridays and flexible work arrangements. We strongly value the health and wellness of our teammates and through our state-of-the-art fitness center, full-time personal trainer on staff, and fitness classes (both in person and remote), we’re helping our teammates reach their wellness goals while at work. Add on generous health and dental/vision options, retirement plans, learning and development programs, career path frameworks, tuition reimbursement, company options and bonus potential you have many ways to take advantage of a comprehensive benefits package that means the most to you!  Learn More About First Orion: First Orion helps businesses generate more revenue, increase efficiency, and improve the customer experience by empowering them to brand their phone calls with their name, logo and reason for calling. We are the market leader in branded communications technology, and a trusted partner to Fortune 500 companies and the largest U.S. mobile carriers. First Orion has been voted a Great Place to Work with top rankings in every category. Learn more about what our employees have to say on our First Orion Glassdoor page and watch our People First Diversity Statement/Video . First Orion Culture Cornerstones are at the core of everything we do here.  Disclosure: First Orion is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Activities, duties and responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice, based on the changing needs of our business. At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas, such as H-1B, for this particular position. First Orion is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. First Orion’s immigration sponsorship policy is applied in a nondiscriminatory fashion regardless of race, gender, ethnic origin, or any other classification protected by law. About Us About Us Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, resulting in increased access to educational funding and improved outcomes. The Meritize platform promotes the growth and development of skills-based careers on behalf of students, educators and employers through innovative funding solutions, skills building programs and career success services. Key Responsibilities Key Responsibilities If you are looking to work alongside a team of highly energetic, passionate and driven people, then this opportunity may be for you. Reporting to the Chief Analytics Officer, here are the key things this Data Analyst will be doing: Process large-scale information for reporting and analytical initiatives Combine disparate data types and sources into production views and datasets Generate, and automate, timely and accurate business reports to support all lines of business Create and productionize data accuracy and consistency checks Identify risk and opportunity in the efficiency, accuracy, and consistency of data and reporting of the Company Process large-scale information for reporting and analytical initiatives Combine disparate data types and sources into production views and datasets Generate, and automate, timely and accurate business reports to support all lines of business Create and productionize data accuracy and consistency checks Identify risk and opportunity in the efficiency, accuracy, and consistency of data and reporting of the Company Qualifications Qualifications Working closely with the team, this person will meet the following requirements: 2-4 years’ experience in business or data analytics Experience working with data tools such as SQL, Python, and Excel Experience with data analytics, data modeling, and business automation tools Programming skills (SQL and Python), and knowledge of information systems (MySQL, Quicksight a plus) Prior ETL experience (Python-based) is preferred 2-4 years’ experience in business or data analytics Experience working with data tools such as SQL, Python, and Excel Experience with data analytics, data modeling, and business automation tools Programming skills (SQL and Python), and knowledge of information systems (MySQL, Quicksight a plus) Prior ETL experience (Python-based) is preferred Meritize is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Meritize is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Vision insurance 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Vision insurance Experience level: 2 years 2 years Schedule: Monday to Friday Monday to Friday Experience: Data analytics: 2 years (Required) SQL: 2 years (Required) Python: 2 years (Required) Data analytics: 2 years (Required) SQL: 2 years (Required) Python: 2 years (Required) Work Location: Remote

At Bluesight, our mission is to create groundbreaking medication intelligence solutions that increase efficiency, safety and visibility for health systems and pharmaceutical manufacturers. We empower our customers to deliver the right medicine to the right patient at the right time, every time. We are a high growth healthcare information technology company with a start-up 'vibe' but over 2,000 customers tracking medications using our proven solutions.  Bluesight is adding to our Data Analyst team. The Data Analyst team supports the implementation of our new customers onto our software solutions. If you love Excel and Sheets, and digging into data to support successful hospital customer outcomes brings you joy, this is the role for you. Your typical duties: Verify and analyze data input from disparate systems to ensure data integrity using Excel Work closely with the implementation project lead and the customer to track progress, provide timely updates, and review data points with customers Perform data extraction tasks using multiple databases through SQL Develop solutions to support the SFTP automation of ongoing reporting needs Acquire and retrieve data as necessary and assists in troubleshooting of data issues to ease end-user use of application Collaborate with the implementation and engineering team to identify trends and process improvement opportunities through data Work cross functionally with software team to build data pipeline infrastructure Perform reconciliation and quality assurance of client data through the use of analytical and audit procedures Other duties, or special projects, as assigned Your qualifications and skills: Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience 2+ years of experience in data analysis, experience in the healthcare industry a plus Experience in Microsoft Office Suite, with deep expertise in Microsoft Excel Exceptional ability in problem solving, troubleshooting, and have high attention to detail Ability to present results to both non-technical and technical audiences Ability to manage multiple projects across varying timelines Understanding and respect for data privacy and HIPAA requirements Nice to have skills and qualifications: Experience in Structured query language (SQL) Knowledge of hospital data systems (e.g. EHR, ADS, purchasing reports, etc.) Experience in Python, R, or Ruby or other scripting language Experience working with PHI or other sensitive data $65,000 - $80,000 a year The standard base pay range for this role is $65,000 - $80,000. In addition to a base salary this position is also eligible for an amazing benefits package. Actual amount of salary will vary depending on position offered, experience, performance, and location. This position is a remote position and open to applicants in the continental United States.  Why Bluesight? Bluesight’s culture is built on innovation and teamwork. There’s room to grow and opportunities to take initiative. You will partner with sharp, motivated teammates looking to disrupt a massive industry—and have fun doing it. We truly believe that where you work and what you do matters. Join us as we revolutionize the hospital pharmacy landscape! Competitive salary Time off when you need it – unlimited vacation days! Generous insurance coverage 401k program with a company match Fun, collaborative culture!  EOE AA M/F/VET/Disability  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. What we're looking for? Do you look at websites and think about how they might be personalized? Do you use websites and apps and think about how their features have been designed to be best for a lot of different users? Do you read articles with statistics and think about how they may be misinterpreting the data to get their results? If these things describe you, and if you’re great at SQL and have experience analyzing website data, you’re someone we want to talk to. We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst with experience analyzing website data. Our data analyst team analyzes everything on our website, not only for their immediate use but also for how they connect to high-level company KPIs. The role requires understanding web development and how data is gathered, analysis of site usage and a/b tests, data visualization and how different kinds of data can be presented most clearly, and business KPIs and how they are measured. But more than that, we’re looking for experienced analysts that can bring us new ideas about how to analyze and extract insights from website data. Our ideal candidates have measured KPIs that we haven’t measured or used new ways to explain user retention, or analyzed features of users data that we haven’t analyzed. The best thing about our work is that we’re part of an incredibly data-driven company. Everyone from the CEO down uses data every day. The data teams are involved in every single thing the company does. Why we’re a great company to work for Seeking Alpha is the leading online destination for engaged investors. We have an awesome product. Our crowdsourced research and cutting-edge investing tools are helping nearly 300,000 paying subscribers exceed their financial goals. We care about work-life balance: We work primarily from home, provide lots of perks, and insist that you enjoy them. We invest in people. We consider each employee a long-term investment, and we see value in continuously nurturing and training our teammates. If that's what you're looking for too- go ahead and apply!  Requirements:  Requirements: A minimum of 4 years in a B2C website-related Data Analyst position Strong SQL skills with experience writing complex and efficient analytical queries Demonstrated experience with working directly with business stakeholders, understanding their needs, and explaining results Experience with data visualization tools (Looker/Tableau/PowerBI) Understanding of website development and operations and how they connect to data gathered Advantage - Looker Experience with report writing and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling/mapping, methodology development, and data modeling The applicable salary range for this position is $70,000/yr to $90,000/yr which depends on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs, and market demand.  Responsibilities:  Responsibilities: Analyzing the behavior of users on our site and apps: Build and maintain dashboards that visualize the usage of single or multiple features and how that usage drives company KPIs. Answer questions about site usage or user behavior based on deeper analyses. Analyze and track high-level KPIs such as conversion, retention, churn, recurring revenue, engagement, cross-device usage, e-mail and notification usage, and more. Communicate with business stakeholders on analysis results, how they relate to business, and what business suggestions result from the analysis. Run the whole data flow for site and app features, from defining KPIs, specifying data collection for development team implementation, and building and maintaining iterative versions of dashboards with both low-level and high-level views of collected data. Split tests of product features: Design a test with clear success criteria Monitor test integrity Analyze results and give recommendations Use segmentation and clear cohort analysis to validate significant conclusions Conduct exploratory analysis to identify trends and opportunities What we're looking for? Who We Are At Lucet, we are industry leaders in behavioral health, dedicated to helping people live healthy, balanced lives. Our mission - and our passion - is to improve the lives of the members we serve and be the ideal partner for our providers. Lucet's unique combination of people and technology has proven to optimize access to behavioral health care providers and increase a health plan's ability to connect members to quality care. With the industry's largest network of care navigators and technology powered by more than six million assessments and more than 20 years of data, Lucet is the only solution proven to successfully identify and connect people across the entire acuity spectrum with the right care in less than five days on average, and often as little as one day. Our members, providers and partners fully entrust us to deliver outstanding quality care through coordinated behavioral health services, employee assistance programs, organizational consulting, student well-being programs and more. When you join Lucet, you become a valued member of our team, serving more than 15 million people across the U.S. Our employees have a passion for helping others - and it shows. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we are inspired by our members, putting them first in everything we do. From day one, you'll see firsthand the impact you have on our members, knowing you can make a true difference in their lives.  Job Summary This exciting and challenging new role is responsible for day-to-day analysis of and interpretation of clinical, provider, and health payer data to improve clinical outcomes and drive better business decisions around technology innovation that drives optimized access to behavioral health care for all who need it.  Essential Functions Contributing to business decisions through a data lens by providing in depth analysis of different clinical management and health payer data Creation, and review, of documentation of the existing technical ecosystems data structures Creation, and review, of documentation of existing data flows for all key data types Ability to apply analysis concepts. Specifically, the evaluation of current state against desired future state with consideration to standards, compliance, quality, operational workflow implications, reliability, and usability of not only our systems but also the data within our systems Acts as the centralized and initial point of contact for data analysis requests or issue investigation for assumed or identified data issues and on-demand business data analysis requests Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and propose solutions Partner cross-functionally across the enterprise to effectively communicate analysis findings and insights to non-technical business partners Create reports to monitor data to ensure accuracy and validate Key Performance expectations of enhancements or emerging data trends. Management of multiple tasks and projects within targeted timelines Assist in defining and creating technology ecosystem database architecture. Write and revise complex SQL queries using optimization design patterns. Reverse engineer data models.  Job Qualifications Required Degree related to data analytics/science, or information technology field, or 5 years relevant experience in data analysis. 5+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or IT experience working with SQL writing complex queries. Extremely motivated and willing to work in a fast-paced, hard-working environment. Understanding of data warehouse technical architectures and data modeling. Knowledge of Relational Database Design, Stored Procedures, and T-SQL Experience with Excel Pivot Tables/Dynamic Dashboards/Array Functions/etc., Tableau, and SQL Server Management Studio  Key Competencies Thrives on change and readily accepts new assignments and challenges. Ability to work independently and in team environments to complete assigned tasks. Ability to effectively present complex information to employees at all levels of the organization. Ability to think critically and apply information to identify and mitigate risk. Ability to manage time, prioritize and multi-task.  Working Conditions Work is performed indoors in a typical home office environment- not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions. Frequent exposure to VDT screen. Physical demands include constant ability to remain in a stationary position, move about inside an office or remote setting, able to communicate and exchange information with others, able to inspect information, and able to perform repetitive motion with arms and fingers. Mental demands include constant ability to interpret data, problem solve, make decisions, and organize and plan.  Salary and Other Compensation: The starting salary that Lucet reasonably expects to pay for this position ranges from $69,000 - $118,000 annually, depending on circumstances including an applicant's skills, education/degrees, certifications, prior experience, market data, and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of Lucet's incentive plan based on both company performance and individual performance. Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k) with competitive employer match, company paid life and disability insurance, company paid gym access, tuition reimbursement, parental leave, PTO (vacation, sick and volunteering), Remote Work. Who We Are We Are At Lucet, we are industry leaders in behavioral health, dedicated to helping people live healthy, balanced lives. Our mission - and our passion - is to improve the lives of the members we serve and be the ideal partner for our providers. is to improve the lives of the members we serve Lucet's unique combination of people and technology has proven to optimize access to behavioral health care providers and increase a health plan's ability to connect members to quality care. From day one, you'll see firsthand the impact you have on our members, knowing you can make a true difference in their lives. We are seeking individuals who desire to use their unique skills to innovate and make an impact. The Business Data Analyst I will support and contribute to business analytics projects and processes to provide data-driven insights related to business performance. This information is used to advise and develop strategies for operational improvements and future business initiatives for the Bursar and Business Offices. This position works closely with the Director of Finance, Director of Financial Aid, Registrar, and Information Technology.  JOB SPECIFICATIONS: EDUCATION/EXPERTISE: Bachelor’s degree in business/finance, computer science, or information technology from an accredited college. 2-4 years of relevant work experience creating data maps, documenting business processes, and working with customers to improve processes. Previous experience with Jenzabar is a plus. 2-4 years of relevant experience in data retrieval and ad-hoc reporting tools (SQL and SQL Reporting Services). Experience in System integrations. 2-4 years working with internal customers to implement and support software. Working experience in higher education is a plus A data analytics certificate is a plus.  JOB REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/ETC: Ability to exercise sound judgment in organizing work and setting priorities, balancing the interests of customers, and readily readjusting priorities to respond to their needs and expectations. Demonstrated strong ethical, professional, service-oriented, and interpersonal skills. Ability to provide excellent customer service in a positive and solutions-based manner. Problem-solving skills. Ability to learn and grow in the area of focus. Common Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Research skills. Analytical skills with organizational and writing ability. Experience in report creation, writing and technical requirements analysis, data and business processes modeling/mapping, and methodology development.  ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Responsible for the creation and maintenance of various BI reports, analysis, data models, or analytical tools to provide analytical support to the Bursar and Business Office. Analyze information needs within the Bursar and Business Office and develop technology solutions to meet those needs. Interprets critical data sets. Develop and/or utilize a defined set of management, tracking, and reporting tools. Required to conduct business lawfully and ethically by consistently adhering to compliance policies, procedures, and regulations. Other tasks as assigned.  WHY PARKER? Job Description: Data Analyst About the Role: The Data Analyst will create custom reports, and collect data from the various systems that Burrell uses. Reviewing and tracking reports from various departments, which will include Data collection and hour calculation by service code, sending worksheets for review, make revisions, and issue final draft, Track and report on performance trends including financial and operational measures (i.e. revenue, no-shows, service counts, etc.) The ability to build strong working relationships is necessary, in this role you will serve as a liaison among many different management levels to provide consistent and ongoing organizational support in order to achieve accuracy, efficiency, and satisfactions when using clinical and institutional data. Qualifications: Minimum 2+ years experience in reporting/data collection Experience with SQL, Excel, Tableau, and/or Crystal Report building in IBM COGNOS or similar business analytic programs Bachelor's Degree preferred - equivalent work experience may be considered What we offer: Great pay, excellent employee benefits, a Monday through Friday 8am-5pm schedule, and an organizational culture like no other. Burrell’s dedication to promoting diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion is clearly reflected in all of our content and across all of our agency. Diversity is more than a commitment at Burrell—it is the foundation of what we do. We are fully focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different. We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital status, disability or veteran status, or to other non-work related factors. Burrell is a Smoke and Tobacco Free Workplace. Our mission at Talkspace is to make therapy affordable and accessible to everyone. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Want to help over one million people feel better? Come join our team!  We are looking for a BI Data Analyst who believes, as we do, that digital therapy provides an unprecedented opportunity to improve mental health. At Talkspace, you'll be working with people who are passionate about data, and excited to achieve our mission of bringing quality mental healthcare to all. As a BI Data Analyst, you will be a part of a collaborative and mission-driven Data Science and Machine Learning Team. Please note: This position is NYC-based and may require in-person work 2-4 times a month in NYC.  About This Role Data Analysis Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to support Talkspace's product and partnership initiatives with data-driven recommendations. Collect analytical requirements, write database queries, and build automated reports for internal business stakeholders and external partners. Think critically, test hypotheses, and leverage data to test and iterate on new product features and business strategies. Communication & Teamwork Work with a team of both technical and non-technical stakeholders to turn insight into action. Communicate the story behind the data to non-technical stakeholders, translating insights into results. Mental Health Outcomes Use statistics to identify themes and trends that help us to understand and communicate how Talkspace is affecting patient mental health outcomes: What are we doing well and what do we need to improve?   About You 3-6 years of experience in an analytical role BA/BS in quantitative field like statistics, applied mathematics, economics, computer science, or equivalent experience Proficiency in SQL, python, and Excel / Google Sheets Comfortable with statistics and data manipulation Experience with data visualization software like Looker or Tableau a plus Experience with product analytics tools like Mixpanel a plus A creative problem solver who knows that the first step is to understand the question. A strong growth mindset and an interest in building out your data skillset with an emphasis on systems thinking Eager to transform the solutions you create into new tools for the future   Bonus Points: MBA Healthcare or Telehealth experience   Compensation At Talkspace, we believe that pay transparency during the interview process is a critical part of diversity, equity, and inclusion. The hourly rate is based on internal and external compensation benchmarks, which we regularly evaluate to ensure we pay competitively. The salary range for this role is between $85,000.00 and $150,000.00. Within the hourly rate, leveling corresponds to each candidate's relevant experience, skills as assessed during the interview process, education, and applicable certifications.  Why Talkspace? Talkspace is the most comprehensive and convenient way to take care of your mental health and wellness, focused on providing quality mental health services on your own terms. Our signature psychotherapy and psychiatry product connects individual users with a network of thousands of licensed mental health providers through an easy-to-use and HIPAA-compliant web and mobile platform. With Talkspace, users can connect their dedicated provider via live video, text, or phone. Backed by over 10 years of industry-leading research and clinically proven results, our accessible care model continues to make huge strides in lowering the barriers to quality mental healthcare services nationwide. Talkspace is the top insurance-covered therapy service with over 112 million Americans covered and a leader within the Corporate Wellness Space, with more than 200 employer partnerships across several industries. Our focus to help people feel better starts at Talkspace, where we connect and collaborate as a team to make the world a better place. Fun company-wide events, happy hours, wellness perks, flex PTO, access to Talkspace products, and competitive benefits are just some of the ways we make Talkspace a great place to work. Do you want to save the world? Come join us!  EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Talkspace welcomes and celebrates talent from all backgrounds, perspectives, and walks of life to foster an innovative and diverse workforce. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet every qualification, if you believe you could make a great addition to this team. Come as you are and learn about the exciting opportunities on our team. Individuals seeking employment at Talkspace are considered without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law.  How do we define Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging at Talkspace?  Diversity Diversity encompasses the unique attributes of our employees as individuals. We value and embrace the richness arising from their varied backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences, which include, but are not limited to, age, ability, ethnicity, gender, race, and cultural background. Equity Equity refers to a fair and impartial workplace, aiming to ensure equal growth and advancement opportunities for all employees. This involves amplifying underrepresented voices, addressing unconscious biases, and providing inclusive, culturally competent mental health care. Inclusion Inclusion signifies the practice of granting equal access to opportunities and resources for all employees, particularly those who might otherwise be excluded or marginalized. It ensures that everyone feels a sense of belonging, value, support, and respect as an individual. Belonging Belonging reflects the affinity and positive relationships that develop among employees from diverse backgrounds when businesses actively promote diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace. TransCore (TRN), a subsidiary of ST Engineering, is seeking a full-time Data Analyst I to join our team in Nashville, Tennessee. Summary: The Data Analyst will be a member of our database and reports (Business Intelligence Analytics) team who will write stored procedures, design/modify/support database tables, create and modify reports using Microsoft reporting services and Tableau, perform unit testing, participate in release activities of the database as it goes through the development cycle, and participate in supporting the product. We use SSMS, SSRS, Tableau, Visual Studio, DevOps, and Teams/SharePoint regularly. The ideal candidate for this position is eager to learn, has an analytical mind, a drive to see tasks through to their conclusion, a willingness to work in a multi-location team environment and is receptive to constructive feedback from colleagues. Attention to detail is a must. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following, but are not limited to: Write queries and stored procedures. Design, modify, and support database tables. Create and develop Tableau reports for data analysis. Accept and apply feedback and detailed editing requirements. Optimize and maintain legacy code. Analyze the flow of data throughout the system to validate functionality. Develop new backend processes. Support database development for report creation. Troubleshoot performance problems, fine-tune databases, and perform index analysis. Support other members of the team by participating in peer code reviews and testing cycles. Work closely with other members of the team to maintain component reusability and integrity of the system. Other duties as assigned. Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related Engineering field with 2 years of relevant experience is preferred Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Data Analytics, or a related field is highly desirable. Combination of equivalent experience and education may be considered. Required Skills & Experience Experience in MS SQL Server, Tableau or Power BI and MS Word and Excel is required. Excellent analytical and organizational skills Ability to deliver projects on time and with a high quality of code. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, both at the detail and summary levels Visual Studio, .NET development Large database and transaction processing Experience with SQL Server System Integration Services / Data warehousing / Business Intelligence preferred. Analysis of business requirements and technical requirements in order to develop and enhance complex code. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Job Title : Data Analyst Job Title : Data Analyst Location :Cupertino ,CA (Hybrid) Location :Cupertino ,CA (Hybrid) Duration :9 Months Duration :9 Months Client is Looking for "Store Experience Product Launch Global Data Analyst" Duties: •Own the global Channel store merchandising landscape in preparation of a product launch: Perform data validation and scrubbing, working with inputs from regional teams •Forecast store demos and security elements for product launches: Develop models based on current merchandising to forecast demand at SKU-level based on global strategy, against a fluctuating baseline •Contribute to marketing strategy: Be resourceful using sales and merchandising datasets, along with tools to research and develop insights that contribute to strategy decisions •Tell stories with data every day: Propose and defend your ideas with strong research and compelling analyses to internal cross-functional team and sales/marketing leadership stakeholders •NPI Project management: Lead projects across internal planning, merchandising, supply/demand and country/regional teams to ensure forecast accuracy and supply availability within a defined schedule •A mix of team & independent work: manage your deliverables and deadlines independently, but connect everything to the bigger picture with your colleagues; communicate the status and results of your independent projects to cross-functional forums Hard Skills: Very strong Excel and data management; Data visualizations (Tableau/Power BI), analysis and reporting across several levels of the organization; MacOS and iOS; Experience with supply/demand planning, inventory management or retail merchandising an asset Soft Skills: Detail-oriented; Comfortable working in an extremely agile, collaborative, fast-paced environment with a lot of ambiguity; comfortable working with highly sensitive information; resourceful; deadline-driven; strong problem solving; ability to prioritize multiple, conflicting deliverables; Ideal candidates would have a passion for data storytelling, problem solving, and an interest in collaborating with others to shape the in-store experience for a major tech brand Education: Bachelor’s degree or data analysis certifications preferred. About Energo Energo is a rapidly growing energy supplier that provides a broad range of energy products and services to customers in NY, NJ, PA and MD. Please visit our website for more information: https://energo.com/ Energo is an equal opportunity employer, and applicants considered will not be because of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Job Summary Energo is seeking a positive, goal-oriented Analytics Data Analyst. The Analytics Data Analyst is a key member of the Systems and Risk team and will primarily be supporting the Operations department with customer enrollments, database management, billing, and reporting. Attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment, organizational skills and ability to organize and analyze data are necessary skills to succeed within this role. Multi-tasking is a must! Company offers a competitive salary based on experience, benefits, and 401K plan. Overview Responsibilities: Develop, implement, and improve data collection and reporting for both internal and external teams Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain data systems Interpret, process and analyze complex billing data for Operations Assist with the enhancement of the billing system to meet the requirements necessary to enroll and bill customers receiving energy supply from Energo Proactively identify and implement operational improvements, enhancements, and system customizations that meet business requirements Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Support weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting Ad hoc assignments This position reports to the VP of Risk and Systems. As stated below, the role is remote but selected consultants will need to be in the New York / NJ / CT / PA Metro area since they may need to come in to the office from time to time. Start/End Dates: 1/24/2022 - 1/23/2023 Work Location: 2 Broadway - MTA Headquarters Job Title: 14357 Database Administration - Data Warehouse (DW) Years of Experience: Tier 3: 7-9 Yrs Average Rate: $70.00 Hourly NO O.T.  Job Description: *PLEASE NOTE THIS POSITION WILL ALLOW CONSULTANT TO WORK REMOTELY. HOWEVER, CONSULTANT WILL BE REQUIRED TO COME ONSITE AS NEEDED BY THEIR MANAGER/TEAM (AT THEIR OWN EXPENSE).  SUMMARY OF ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:  MTA is looking to onboard a Data Analyst.  The Open Data Coordinator coordinates the publishing of MTA data to the New York State Open Data portal as required under recently enacted state law (the MTA Open Data Act, legislative bills S4625A/A1442B, and Section 1279-i of the Public Authorities Law). The role will develop the catalog of publishable MTA data (consisting of both currently published and unpublished datasets), create a plan and schedule for publishing this data on the State's open data portal, and coordinate the initial and ongoing publishing of that data per the plan. In carrying out this work, the Analyst recommends changes to data pipelines and data storage to facilitate efficient publishing of the data.  NYS Open Data Portal publishes data to the NYS open data portal as well as develop an internal MTA data portal where data will be housed.  REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:  Coordinate and collaborate with data owners to identify systems and datasets containing information that are of interest and value and therefore useful to publish Perform data analysis, data profiling, and data mapping activities for new data sources Translate data requirements into technical documents Interface with Data Engineers to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from a wide variety of data sources to ensure the timely and seamless delivery of data Develop scripts and queries to import, manipulate, clean, and transform data from different sources Working with Data Engineering in Designing and building tools that make our data pipelines more reliable, manageable and resilient. Ensure we have data consistency between production and analytical databases. Work with Data Engineering in Architecting our Open Data Catalog Support and resolve data inquiries with accuracy and in a timely manner; Triage, troubleshoot and help remediate issues Contribute towards documentation of the processes/projects  What we're looking for:  Bachelors in Computer Science or similar experience Experience working with relational databases like Oracle, Microsoft SQL, MySQL; Data Warehouses and Data Lakes. Proficiency in SQL and Python Experience using Power BI, Tableau or similar tools. Experience with Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services Experience with large-scale data pipelines and ETL tools is preferred Strict confidentiality of sensitive customer data. Experience working with Git (rebasing/merging, cherry picking, conflict resolution, etc.) A team player with a solution oriented attitude with both the technical and soft skills to get things done. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Experience with Jira and Confluence for documentation. THIS IS A 1099 INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR ROLE WITH NO BENEFITS. PAY RATE IS $65/hr. ALL VISA TYPES OK EXCEPT OPT & CPT. PLEASE APPLY IF YOU AGREE WITH THESE TERMS. Role Overview: Responsibilities: Gain a deep understanding of our manufacturing operations, data sources, and business objectives. Design and implement robust data models ensure accurate and reliable data analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish data collection methodologies aligned with manufacturing goals. Acquire, clean, and transform complex datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process. Utilize statistical methods and data mining techniques to analyze manufacturing data, identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights. Develop interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports using Power BI, providing stakeholders with real-time access to critical information. Generate regular reports and deliver data-driven presentations to communicate findings and recommendations effectively. Collaborate with IS team to maintain and optimize the data infrastructure and systems on the Azure platform, ensuring data availability, security, and scalability. Stay updated on industry best practices, advancements in data analytics, Azure platform capabilities, and Power BI features to drive continuous improvement and innovation. Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing analytical support and expertise to address specific operational challenges or strategic initiatives. Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis. Experience in designing and implementing data models, ETL processes, and data integration workflows. Proficient in developing interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI. Familiarity with Azure services, including Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, Azure ML, and Azure Data Factory. Solid understanding of statistical analysis techniques and machine learning algorithms. Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and data visualization skills. Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner. Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities. Data Analyst Data Analyst At The Modern Groom and Nick’s Menswear, we are a team of individuals who are passionate about making sure the groom and groomsmen look and feel their best on one of the most important days of the groom’s life - the wedding day! We love what we do and our customer reviews reflect our commitment to excellence and willingness to do whatever it takes to make sure working with us is the easiest part of the wedding planning process. If you have a knack for data analysis and are looking for a fulfilling career with an innovative company, look no further! We are actively seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our expanding team. Enough about us, here’s what we’re looking for from you! Enough about us, here’s what we’re looking for from you! As a key member of our analytics team, you will play a crucial role in extracting valuable insights from complex datasets. Collaborating closely with our Senior Director of Growth Marketing & Ecommerce, you’ll be instrumental in developing data-driven strategies that fuel our growth. Your ability to transform raw data into actionable insights will significantly enhance our operational efficiency and decision-making processes. We’re seeking an individual who thrives on diving into data, applying statistical techniques to uncover trends, opportunities and challenges. Your skill in communicating these insights clearly and effectively will empower our team to make informed choices. If this resonates with you, read on to explore what your role entails on a daily basis. Responsibilities: Analyze data from various sources, including sales tax, customer base, customer service, and other sources. Introduction Last year our HCA Healthcare colleagues invested over 156,000 hours volunteering in our communities. As a Data Analyst II with HCA Healthcare you can be a part of an organization that is devoted to giving back! Benefits HCA Healthcare, offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include: Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation. Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more. Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing 401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service) Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stock Family support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance. Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and more Consumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer Discounts Retirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnerships Education assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships) Colleague recognition program Time Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence) Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income. Learn more about Employee Benefits Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.  Would you like to unlock your potential with a leading healthcare provider dedicated to the growth and development of our colleagues? Join the HCA Healthcare family! We will give you the tools and resources you need to succeed in our organization. We are looking for an enthusiastic Data Analyst II to help us reach our goals. Unlock your potential! Job Summary and Qualifications Job Summary: Primary Purpose of the job As a member of the Software Asset Management team that focuses on maintaining software license compliance and software license optimization for enterprise desktop and server environments, this role will assist team members in: Researching and analyzing software license purchase and software discovery data and perform reconciliation and remediation tasks to ensure data accuracy and quality Working closely with subject matter experts, including system architects, system administrators, project managers, financial managers, engineers and leverage HCA toolsets to obtain critical information required for effective management of desktop and server software licenses Performing impact assessments on pending or potential architectural or contractual changes, outlining incremental license or maintenance costs due to change and potential cost mitigation opportunities based on license use metrics or product use changes Conducting Enterprise-wide software license modeling and creating a license compliance framework, including standard reporting documentation for a suite of desktop and server products across multiple software publishers Performing Enterprise data analysis for a select portfolio of HCA software vendors related to negotiation and business needs including: current license position, HCA custom contract terms, non-standard use rights and consolidated reporting / tracking related to the respective licensing agreement Identifying Enterprise-wide license compliance issues & risks and assisting in coordinating the remediation of the identified risks Developing and maintaining lines of communication with hospitals, divisions, other corporate departments, and vendors to corporate ITG management concerning feedback on software vendor licensing issues. Actively assess risk and cost reduction opportunities and make recommendations to Software Owners and Software Asset Management leadership to optimize the software asset portfolio Managing day to day requests from end-users to fulfill software licensing needs This position reports to Senior Director, Asset Management and works closely with the in-house software asset management team, the third-party software asset management service provider, the procurement and F&A staff, HCA employees at multiple professional levels including executives, project business owners and vendor staff including those from corporate, field and groups. Responsibilities: Coordinates and leads software license data gathering for software publisher enterprise contract negotiations. Supports business owner strategy planning for license purchases at an Enterprise level. Responsible for creation of a repeatable license compliance plan and process based on available tools and data. Creates and manages software Enterprise licensing models, vendor relationships, business/technical relationships with VARs, internal business stakeholders and internal ITG relationships. Provides software license management consulting and guidance to outside and affiliate businesses. Facilitates relationships between ITG and division/market staff for purposes of license use awareness. For a variety of software publishers, integrates a software license strategy across Corp business owners. Helps develop license harvest models to reduce expense. Identifies future software aggregation opportunities and provide licensing costs and chargeback support for various software products. Provides license guidance and direction to Corp and Division employees who deploy 3rd party software and/or are responsible for licensing compliance. Supports and provides license consultation to asset managers on understanding software licensing models related to their area of responsibility. Qualified candidates must have 5+ years of relevant work experience. Bachelor’s degree required. Other Qualifications This position requires superior judgment, high ethical standards, a strong attention to detail and effective written and verbal communication skills. A successful candidate is comfortable with accountability for decision-making and management authority. Must be comfortable with Microsoft Office products and able to learn and utilize new technology resources as required. Physical Demands / Working Conditions: This job is a largely sedentary role operating in a typical office setting, routinely using standard office equipment such as computers and phones and requiring speaking, hearing, fine motor dexterity. Data Analyst Analytics - Santa Barbara or San Diego At AppFolio, we paddle as one. We ride and make waves together, with a relentless focus on building great products for the way our customers work and live today – and tomorrow. AppFolio is a destination organization where careers are made and accelerated. Here, innovation is a team sport.  We are looking for a Data Analyst to be the Single Point Owner (SPO) of all things product and business analytics for FolioGuard; Appfolio’s Renter’s Insurance business. This role will support the FolioGuard product leadership through enterprise-level Analytics. They will execute thoughtful data analysis using SQL, Python and/or R to discover product improvement opportunities while building tracking and ongoing measurement for KRs, initiatives, and feature launches. They will be the builder and maintainer of data assets such as dashboards, analyses, and reports that provide key business insights. If you excel at using business acumen and analytical skills to deliver impactful business insights that drive revenue and profit - apply now; this is the role for you! Your impact Be the Single Point Owner (SPO) for FolioGuard analytics Become a subject matter expert on the FolioGuard business and data Use and monitor KPIs and raise suggestions, concerns, ideas for how to grow the business based off of data Champion and own data accuracy for FolioGuard Participate in the product and engineering meetings to stay informed and aligned on strategic initiatives, product and feature enhancements, and represent the needs and capabilities of analytics Bring the business context and history of FolioGuard into data-driven analyses Be familiar with logic and Regular full-time employees are eligible for benefits - see here.  #LI-JH1 #LI-Hybrid Data Analyst Data Analyst Analytics - Santa Barbara or San Diego Analytics - Santa Barbara or San Diego At AppFolio, we paddle as one. We ride and make waves together, with a relentless focus on building great products for the way our customers work and live today – and tomorrow. AppFolio is a destination organization where careers are made and accelerated. Here, innovation is a team sport.  We are looking for a Data Analyst to be the Single Point Owner (SPO) of all things product and business analytics for FolioGuard; Appfolio’s Renter’s Insurance business. This role will support the FolioGuard product leadership through enterprise-level Analytics. They will execute thoughtful data analysis using SQL, Python and/or R to discover product improvement opportunities while building tracking and ongoing measurement for KRs, initiatives, and feature launches. They will be the builder and maintainer of data assets such as dashboards, analyses, and reports that provide key business insights. If you excel at using business acumen and analytical skills to deliver impactful business insights that drive revenue and profit - apply now; this is the role for you! Data Quality Analyst Location - Hybrid Role ( must be able to go into office 2-3 times weekly - Peoria, IL - Position’s Contributions to Work Group: Position’s Contributions to Work Group - The objective of the Data Quality Engineer is to investigate quality issues within the Telematics end-to-end system for further quality review. This position will be assisting in the validation of quality rules, investigating data failures, and work with the team to communicate the findings. This could include internal validation of data from rule failures and derived data objects. Typical task breakdown: Typical task breakdown: - Analyze Telemetry data. - Quality Investigations for new issues to determine the severity and affected population. - Investigations include process flow work to determine where a piece of data is not being recorded or sent properly in the flow of data from a Product Link Device to the end customer. - Develop SQL queries to make data sets with defined criteria. - Designing validation test cases. - Communicate results to internal customers, team members, and other business units. - Follow work group process flow. - Candidates need to be local to Peoria for Hybrid model Education & Experience Required: Education & Experience Required: - Two- or Four-year degree from an accredited college or university in an engineering, computer science or other technology related field plus 5+ years exp Technical Skills (Required) Technical Skills - 1-2 years Telematics experience. - Previous experience with OEM Products, and OEM Telematics Products - Analytical skills to interpret data. - 1-2 years SQL query experience (R) - 1-2 years Experience with BI tools (Tableau preferred otherwise Power BI) (Desired) - Knowledge of other functions that regularly provide inputs into telematics quality programs such as, product development, engineering, quality, purchase, and operations Soft Skills (Required) Soft Skills - Potential backgrounds in retail, or related service industry o This role, for a mature team member, will communicate regularly with internal groups. The ability to effectively communicate with this group of people is critically important to the role. - Team Player: o Background in any role that caused them to be a member of a team that could not succeed unless everyone was involved o These investigations and problem-solving roles require a broad range of individuals. The ability to build relationships with the team and work well with them is very important. Individuals who prefer to work alone, or hoard information would not thrive here. Job Type: Contract Pay: $28.00 - $30.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Monday to Friday Experience: SQL: 5 years (Required) Power BI: 5 years (Preferred) Tableau: 5 years (Preferred) SQL: 5 years (Required) Power BI: 5 years (Preferred) Tableau: 5 years (Preferred) Work Location: In person

DATA ANALYST GATEKEEPER SYSTEMS, INC. Foothill Ranch, CA  Gatekeeper Systems stands proudly as the foremost global leader in retail loss prevention, operations management, and analytics, with our headquarters based in Foothill Ranch, California. We maintain a strong presence across the globe, with offices in the UK, Australia, China, Hong Kong, Germany, France, and Canada, fostering a diverse team of 450 talented employees. Over the past 25 years, Gatekeeper Systems has been at the forefront of the industry, demonstrating our commitment to excellence through cutting-edge technologies and unparalleled customer service. Join us on our journey as we continue to revolutionize the retail sector, providing innovative solutions and services that redefine industry standards We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to develop and manage customer facing reporting products. You will be responsible for the development and implementation of BI solutions, from data modeling to analysis and visualization. You will use your technology insight, business acumen and creativity to build and maintain scalable data solutions and automate reporting.  WHAT WE OFFER… Join the team at Gatekeeper Systems and watch your career grow! We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages that include: Attractive Total Compensation Package Flexible hybrid work schedule Comprehensive healthcare benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage; Life/ADD/LTD insurance; FSA/HSA options. 401(k) Plan with Employer Match Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) policy Observance of 11 paid company holidays  ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS; but not limited to: You will be responsible for the design and development of insightful analytics deliverables via a variety of techniques including requirements gathering, data profiling, data analysis, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data visualization. Maintain current dashboards and data infrastructure while building new data infrastructure and tools to address the growing business reporting, analytics and data needs. Design, develop, and maintain automated high-visibility business intelligence reporting to make data valuable, actionable and consumable by end-user customers Develop new reporting to support the business Distribute substantive analysis, collaborate with cross functional teams to evaluate the ongoing effectiveness of operating metrics and measurement methods and continually improve them as needed or direct Conduct ad hoc analyses on a wide variety of data sources Help ensure that data is accurate and consistent Ad-hoc duties as needed  QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Dashboard development Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross functionally Experience gathering end-user requirements and translating them into simple consumable reports or dashboards Strong knowledge of best practices around dashboard design Focus on data validation and accuracy Strong analytical and quantitative skills to manage highly complex information Critical thinking – have the ability to come to new conclusions based on findings Must have a high level of attention to detail – be vigilant in analysis to come to correct conclusions Ability to adapt to fast changes in product requirements and development environment Excellent organizational skills Ability to QA data by reverse engineering data structures Experience with optimizing query and dashboard performance Proficiency in data modeling concepts Power BI, BigQueary, Postgres a big plus  EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent work experience 2-3 years of experience as a data analyst 1-2 years working with programming Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook Experience with LookML and SQL Retail and/or loss prevention industry preferred Repetitive motions and routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, telephones, copiers/scanners and filing cabinets Ability to see, speak, walk, hear, stand, use of hand/fingers to handle or feel; climb stairs, stoop, carry/lifting up to 10 lbs. Sitting at a desk Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus  DISCLAIMER This Job Description is a general overview of the requirements for the position. It is not designed to contain, nor should it be interpreted as being all inclusive of every task which may be assigned or required. It is subject to change, in alignment with company/department needs and priorities. Gatekeeper Systems, Inc., is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to developing a diverse workforce and cultivating an inclusive environment. We value diversity and believe that we are strengthened by the differences in our experiences, thinking, culture, and background. We strongly encourage applications from candidates who demonstrate that they can contribute to this goal. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any protected basis. Who we are: ITRCC is dedicated to delivering outstanding customer service focused on safety and built around our core values: Customer Service, Respect, Excellence, Stewardship, and Teamwork. Spanning 157 miles, across northern Indiana, ITRCC implements our core values to offer a safer and more efficient way of commuting. Why we’re different: ITRCC’s efficiency relies on our team members; at the ITRCC you won’t just be part of a company, you will be part of a family who respects their members and strives to cultivate sustainability. We are actively involved in the community and care for the wellbeing of our team members. We understand the importance of work/life balance while offering hybrid schedules for flexibility and productivity. Plays a key role in monitoring processes, data validation, and identifying and investigating anomalies. Recall Masters is the leading provider of automotive recall information, services, and vehicle owner communications dedicated to helping automakers and their franchise dealers expedite the repair of recalled vehicles and make the roadways safer for everyone. We have partnered with 17 of the top 25 National Dealer Groups, including all the Publics. Recall Masters is looking for a highly organized and results-oriented individual to work as a Performance Manager. The ideal candidate works well with multiple teams within a fast-paced organization and possesses the ability to navigate through various client contacts. In addition to a great compensation plan including benefits, RM offers a collaborative and fun culture where talent thrives and career growth is nearly unlimited. As a data analyst, you will play a crucial role in gathering, interpreting, and analyzing data to provide valuable insights and support informed decision-making. Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools are essential for this position. This is an in-person position at our office in Laguna Hills, CA. Primary Responsibilities DMS Data Retrieval R+ data/art merge (As needed) Internal Macros Upload Monthly mail files ETL Mapping Audi National Reporting Custom reports Duties/Responsibilities: Oversees database development and modification efforts. Designs and implements secure, efficient, and accurate databases. Maintains current and accurate knowledge of data storage and management best practices. Ensures that databases are designed to meet specifications and requirements at the lowest possible costs. Ensures that database projects are completed on time and within estimated costs. Develops and maintains documentation and standards. Assists Senior Database Analyst and identifies and resolves production and/or applications development problems related to the use of the database management system software or utilities. Gathers, organizes, and interprets statistical data from the database to provide reports to, and answer questions from, upper management. Performs other related duties as assigned. Works to assist in process automation and documentation. Other duties assigned by supervisor.    Job Requirements:  Minimum Qualifications Assists Senior Database Analyst and identifies and resolves production and/or applications development problems related to the use of the database management system software or utilities. Gathers, organizes, and interprets statistical data from the database to provide reports to, and answer questions from, upper management. Performs other related duties as assigned. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, or Computer Science or equivalent work experience required. At least three years in Data Processing, with at least two years of experience with database management systems; OR two years as a development programmer/analyst using database techniques under IMS/DB-DL/1 required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Understanding of computer languages used within database. Understanding of database design and construction.  Other Requirements This role leverages a flex-schedule that may involve nontraditional working hours. Must be able to work from the Recall Masters office or remotely from a home office, depending on the candidate’s skills and experience. This position is eligible to US citizens physically residing in the US, any offer of employment is contingent upon background, drug screen, and reference checks. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified. DATA ANALYST - apply at https://premierfranchisemanagementllc.applytojob.com/apply DATA ANALYST - apply at Job Summary: Job Summary: Premier Franchise Management is actively looking for a competent and highly detailed Data Analyst to work full-time in our Franklin, Tennessee location. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of financial principles and excel in providing analytical and data-oriented support to our Premier family. The essential functions of this role will be finding insights in large datasets, synthesizing, and communicating results to drive business results and growth. This person will work cross-functionally with the Finance, Accounting, Sales, and Operations Departments. This position requires a successful candidate to be a self-starter, managing and providing consistent and reliable reporting and analysis, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.

Team CATHEXIS elevates the government contracting experience through rapid response, deep skill, and thoughtful problem-solving and communication. Our core capabilities are our top-tier program and project management, data analytics, and audit services, the backbone of which is our integrated approach to operational excellence. You worked hard to get to where you are. You strive to make every day better than the day before. So do we. Team CATHEXIS operates with an all-in mindset. We are working together to create a company that supports our shared values and individual goals. Our values are centered around Respect, Engagement, Customer Service, Integrity, Teamwork, and Excellence in everything we do for our employees, clients, partners, and communities. We believe success is best when we listen and lead with empathy; model high standards of ethics to provide a rewarding candidate experience; work hard, have fun, and appreciate the strengths we all bring to the team; and empower our employees to create innovative and trusted results. We are looking for a dynamic Data Analyst to join our team Remotely! The Data Analyst will create and manage databases (Excel workbooks, Microsoft Access, basic SQL Server), will design and execute analyses, and will maintain and create new Standard Operating Procedures as needed. Responsibilities: Review and analyze surveys containing attendance data to include attendance demographics Implement and manage data repositories containing large volumes of files Excel workbooks, Access databases, PowerPoint presentations Protect data using document-level encryption Manage data logs and prioritize workload to meet customer timelines Prepare and execute standard operating procedures Design and execute data analyses Design, prepare, and deliver short training classes Develop the technical and analytics skill of junior analysts Provide input for weekly reports Collaborate with others frequently on analyses  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree Three years of experience performing similar tasks Proficient in Microsoft collaboration tools: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, and SharePoint Proficient with Microsoft Power BI Able to obtain a minimum of NACI (National Agency Check with Inquiries) for a Veterans Affairs Public Trust Clearance Qualifications: Strong written and oral communication skills Team player who is a flexible self-starter with strong attention to detail Can consult with others in an effective and polite manner Assumes ownership and responsibility for assigned actions and/or tasks Sets priorities and recognizes when re-prioritization is needed based on project and client needs Ability to organize and synthesize information Exceptional eye for detail in data patterns Preferred Additional Qualifications Previous work as a federal employee or contractor Experience with dashboarding software such as Power BI or Tableau  CATHEXIS is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. What You'll Do: The Global Media Data Analyst, in partnership with the global media agency of record and in-house media channel leads, is responsible for tracking and reporting of digital media strategies for the global full funnel media activity.   Responsibilities include: Analyze media performance data to provide strategic recommendations that are cross-channel and cross-campaign. Work with regional teams to understand local nuances that would help improve global insights. Produce and present global media insight reports to key collaborators on a regular cadence. Pull media data and visualize information in a meaningful way. Assist in data QA and work with data engineers to tackle any data discrepancies. Supervise and maintain the performance of paid media data warehouse. Collaborate with digital marketing teams to integrate paid media data with other marketing databases to build future marketing AI. Design dataflow architecture to optimize data processing and real-time data feeds.   Who you'll work with? Our team works closely with media planning leads globally and the media Agency. We work cross-functionally with digital and advertising experts, product marketing leads, and collaborate with the creative AORs. You will have an unique opportunity to work with global teams and steward global media campaigns from concept to execution.  Who you are? You have experience with media planning, media performance analysis, and optimization across paid and organic digital channels – search, social, programmatic, content syndication, and traditional media. You can lead multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and are able to work effectively within a cross-functional team. You have excellent communication skills, both oral and written.  Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or have studied in advertising, marketing, communications, or related field and you're a digital enthusiast with an understanding of digital media and analytics 2+ years experience in developing and executing successful digital media plans or media data; agency experience a plus Experience with database management and SQL programming Experience with DOMO, Hadoop, Tableau, Snowflake, and Python are a plus Project management, critical thinking, data analysis, and organizational skills   Why Cisco? #WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters - with people like you!   Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data travelling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and size to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world - whether through 5G, or otherwise.   We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another - from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).   We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.   So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing?
