Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco #WeAreCisco Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:  When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process. U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program. Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid. Jr Utility Data Analyst - REMOTE! Jr Utility Data Analyst - REMOTE! Be part of the team which has delivered over $500 Million dollars in refunds and savings to clients, and join us as we march toward One Billion dollars! UtiliSave is seeking qualified candidates for Junior Data Analyst position. This is a business critical hands-on role and the ideal candidate will have a record of success in a role focused on gathering data, cost analysis, analyzing complicated laws and regulations, and identifying cases, opportunities and solutions. This position interfaces directly with customers, so strong communication, presentation and client management skills are also essential. Previous familiarity with utility regulations, rates and billing is a must. Responsibilities Responsibilities Apply your analytical and programming (Python, SQL, R) skills and general business knowledge to identify cost savings opportunities for clients. About aSa: About aSa: aSa is a global supplier of software solutions to the concrete reinforcing steel industry. aSa provides, implements, and supports customers in North-Central-South America, Europe, Australia/New Zealand, India and the Middle East. Our office is located outside of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. aSa offers a casual, friendly working atmosphere, as well as a competitive salary with profit sharing, paid vacation, and excellent benefits. aSa offers a hybrid work environment. Mentoring is available to foster internal advancement. We are an equal opportunity employer. Visit our website at www.asaHQ.com aSa offers a hybrid work environment. Junior Data Analyst Junior Data Analyst We are seeking an enthusiastic and professional individual to create and assist our customers in the creation of reports, inquiries, and dashboards. This will help our customers to make better business decisions and increase their productivity. Responsibilities also include defining and monitoring user analytics within the software. Employee will work with aSa staff and customers during software implementations to gather reporting requirements. Environmental Allies is looking for an analyst to join our growing team. This individual should have a passion for researching and collecting data. They need to have outstanding excel skills to help them analyze data and company trends. This individual will be extracting data and creating reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for business initiatives along with working with executive management daily on special projects. This is a full time in the office position. Duties & Responsibilities Duties & Responsibilities · Responsible for researching data trends and identifying opportunities for business improvement · Collaborating with executive team members to collect and analyze data · Responsible to process, interpret and deliver actionable insight · Ensure all data sources are checked at regular intervals · Creating internal reports and visual presentations · Conduct market research for pricing recommendations and develop action items for workflow improvement processes · Establish KPIs to measure business decisions · Communicate daily with all level’s executive management · Have an energetic and positive approach to problem solving · Be comfortable with ambiguity, deadlines, and multiple/sometimes competing deadlines Qualifications / Competencies Qualifications / Competencies · Bachelor's degree (B. A.) · 1 to 2 years related experience or training preferred · Ability to think creatively and ‘outside the box’ · Must have analytical experiences and a thorough understanding of construction bidding process preferred · Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (extensive Excel and PowerPoint experience) · Experience with ERP system (i.e. Acumatica, J.D. Edwards, Dynamics etc.) · Excellent written and verbal communication skills · Knowledge of civil construction industry preferred Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $16.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) AD&D insurance Dental insurance Disability insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance 401(k) AD&D insurance Dental insurance Disability insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Experience level: 1 year 1 year Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Day shift Monday to Friday Experience: data research: 1 year (Preferred) data research: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: In person

ThompsonGas is the nation’s fastest growing propane retailer, and we are looking for innovative, outside of the box thinkers who want to make an impact. We are rethinking the way we do business and, as a result, our employees are empowered to take an idea and run with it. If you are looking for an environment that will allow you the freedom to drive change, create an unrivaled customer experience and have fun while you’re doing it – then ThompsonGas is for you!  Summary: We are seeking a talented and analytical BI Data Analyst to join our growing team. With strong technical skills in data analysis, including proficiency in SQL, Python, and other analytical tools, the BI Data Analyst will play a crucial role in interpreting data to drive business improvement. This role involves a variety of responsibilities such as documentation, cleaning, processing, and analyzing data. Working closely with technical teams, the BI Data Analyst will extract valuable insights from data, providing complex data analysis that translates into actionable business insights. This is a hybrid role, based out of our Frederick, MD Corporate Office. Essential Job Duties: Develops clear and comprehensive internal documentation for data processes, methodologies, and systems, ensuring that technical information is accessible and understandable for all relevant stakeholders. Collects data from various sources, integrating and storing it to provide a solid foundation for analysis. Works on cleaning and preprocessing data to ensure its accuracy, preparing it for further analysis. Offers support and training to end-users on BI tools and reports, enhancing their ability to utilize data. Produces a variety of visual reports, graphs, summaries, and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs. Performs basic research on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis. Combines data as needed from disparate data sources to complete analysis through visualizations and dashboard creation, while providing and owning best practices Participates in defining business intelligence requirements for projects and data requests. Participates in multiple enterprise-wide projects by providing data analysis to project leaders.  Education and Experience: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Technology, or related field. Master's degree preferred but not required. Experience: 0-2 years of experience in data analysis, BI tools, or related field. Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL, Python, BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), and data warehousing solutions. Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Soft Skills: Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.  PERKS WITH US! This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, and transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. ThompsonGas is the nation’s fastest growing propane retailer, and we are looking for innovative, outside of the box thinkers who want to make an impact. We are rethinking the way we do business and, as a result, our employees are empowered to take an idea and run with it. If you are looking for an environment that will allow you the freedom to drive change, create an unrivaled customer experience and have fun while you’re doing it – then ThompsonGas is for you!  Summary: We are seeking a talented and analytical BI Data Analyst to join our growing team. With strong technical skills in data analysis, including proficiency in SQL, Python, and other analytical tools, the BI Data Analyst will play a crucial role in interpreting data to drive business improvement. This role involves a variety of responsibilities such as documentation, cleaning, processing, and analyzing data. Working closely with technical teams, the BI Data Analyst will extract valuable insights from data, providing complex data analysis that translates into actionable business insights. This is a hybrid role, based out of our Frederick, MD Corporate Office. Essential Job Duties: Develops clear and comprehensive internal documentation for data processes, methodologies, and systems, ensuring that technical information is accessible and understandable for all relevant stakeholders. Collects data from various sources, integrating and storing it to provide a solid foundation for analysis. Works on cleaning and preprocessing data to ensure its accuracy, preparing it for further analysis. Offers support and training to end-users on BI tools and reports, enhancing their ability to utilize data. Produces a variety of visual reports, graphs, summaries, and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs. Performs basic research on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis. Combines data as needed from disparate data sources to complete analysis through visualizations and dashboard creation, while providing and owning best practices Participates in defining business intelligence requirements for projects and data requests. Participates in multiple enterprise-wide projects by providing data analysis to project leaders.  Education and Experience: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Information Technology, or related field. Master's degree preferred but not required. Experience: 0-2 years of experience in data analysis, BI tools, or related field. Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL, Python, BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), and data warehousing solutions. Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Soft Skills: Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.  PERKS WITH US! Notre Dame of Maryland University's School of Education is growing and expanding due to its comprehensive program offerings and recognition as the second largest educator of teachers in the State. The school offers State and CAEP-accredited programs ranging from baccalaureate to doctoral level. The School of Education is accepting applications for a full-time data analyst position. The successful candidate will have demonstrated ability in data collection, analysis, reporting, and dissemination, as well as the use of data to inform key decisions. This position is responsible for data collection and analysis to support CAEP accreditation and related professional reports, data for federal and state reports, internal database management and tracking, learning outcomes analytics, Brightspace course data, and school-specific reporting and requirements. Qualifications: The qualified candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in a related field, with a Master's degree preferred and at least one (1) year of experience in data collection, analysis, and reporting in higher education settings. Knowledge of teacher preparation programs in Maryland is preferred. Requires strong interpersonal skills; facility with data collection and analysis; familiarity with statistical software systems and other online data management systems.  All applicants must submit: Cover letter Salary requirements Resume Contact information for 3 professional references  Additional Information: Notre Dame of Maryland University does not discriminate in offering equal access to its educational programs and activities or with respect to employment terms and conditions on the basis of age, ancestry, color, creed, disability, gender, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or protected veteran's status. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policy: Greg FitzGerald, Chief of Staff, Notre Dame of Maryland University, 4701 North Charles Street, Baltimore, MD 21210, 410-532-5109. For all other employment inquiries, please contact Human Resources at 410-532-5898 or human_resources@ndm.edu. Notre Dame of Maryland University is an EEO/AA employer. ou will combine analytical, artistic and technological skills to produce graphics for news content and other Bloomberg Industry Group products. You will collaborate with other analysts and reporters on the team to help our clients navigate the complex policy and legislative landscape in Washington. What you will do: Analyze and interpret legislative, economic, and statistical data. Present information accurately and concisely in charts, tables, maps, and other appropriate graphical formats with a clean and modern design aesthetic. Produce content for BGOV OnPoint slides, bill summaries, news stories, and other products. Collaborate with analysts and reporters to fulfill strategic and creative objectives. Juggle multiple deadlines and keep projects moving forward in a fast-paced news environment.  You need to have: 2 years of experience designing graphics and infographics for print and online media. A Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, statistics, economics, public policy, communications, journalism or related fields or equivalent experience. Demonstrated experience with data visualization, including interactive visualizations and translating those into static versions. Expertise in standard design tools (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, JS/D3 and other dvis frameworks) and Microsoft Office Suite. The Business Analyst is a customer-centric role, supporting the productive and value driven relationship between Chainbridge Solutions and its customers. The BA’s role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of project sponsors and stakeholders. This includes interviewing stakeholders for gathering and compiling detailed user requirements and developing business process flows to convey to development teams throughout the project lifecycle. This position requires leadership, business and technical competencies and the ability to apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support the development process. The BA will ensure project deliverables fully satisfy business needs. Key Responsibilities Serves as liaison between technology and business end-users. Elicits requirements from stakeholders. Translates, simplifies and analyzes the feasibility of requirements to promote business process and solution design efficiency. Translates conceptual user needs into functional business requirements in a clear manner to development teams. Formulates, defines and verifies business cases as well as business and solutions requirements based on both business and user needs. Works with Delivery teams to drive alignment of solutions with business strategies and business capability requirements. Consults with customers to develop process flows reflecting business process requirements. Manages requirements and issues, leveraging tools such as JIRA. Verifies solutions align with requirements. Conducts reviews to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted. Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications to project managers, sponsors and other stakeholders. Formulates, documents and verifies user stories, acceptance criteria, process flows, and mockups. Plays a key role in UAT efforts. Supports the development of release notes, user guides, training materials, etc. Participates in the implementation, and provides post-implementation support. Experience and Skill Requirements 5+ years of relevant Information Solutions /IT experience working in all major phases of software implementation projects. 3-5 years as a Business Analyst, including proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and prioritization. 3+ years of experience in Agile Methodology. Experience with Jira. Diversified experience across multiple business domains and functional areas is preferred. Strong communication and presentation skills. Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving abilities as well as attention to detail. Must possess strong interpersonal and information gathering skills and the ability to relate well to others at all levels throughout the organization. Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task and successfully manage competing/changing priorities. Advanced MS Office skill set to include Excel, PowerPoint and Visio Vaccinated against Covid-19. Physical and Mental Requirements: Frequently remain in a stationary position, often standing or sitting for prolonged periods of time looking at a computer screen. Continuous verbal and written communication with others to exchange information. Continuous repetitive movements that may include the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Comprehension- Must continuously be able to understand direction and adhere to established procedures. Organization- Must continuously be able to gather and classify information. Reasoning and Decision Making- Must continuously use logic to analyze and interpret information and prioritize. Desired Experience and Skills Experience with case management or CMS systems preferred. Experience in the healthcare field preferred. Overview: The Data Analyst, CSB is expected to work with and support the demand for data and information by business users, business analysts, and decision makers. Responsibilities include data analysis, generating dashboards, data visualizations, reports, datasets, and information for end-users using SQL or other data extraction tools, reporting tools, or data visualization tools. Analyze data to aid in addressing complex business problems and issues. Construct models, strategic and tactical plans based on data analysis. Responsibilities: Support internal customers performing a variety of complex queries or analytical tasks. Integrate data from multiple sources to produce required results. Work closely with internal customers providing data analysis support or instruction. Test complex queries and audit data extracts to ensure the data meets requirements. Comply with policies, including but not limited to, defining scope, coding and query standards, quality assurance processes, and data verification policies. Work within Salesforce to support teams within CSB. Perform additional duties as assigned. Qualifications: Baccalaureate degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or a related discipline, or +4 years of data-focused work experience required. Ability to use software tools to gather and extract data for review and analysis is required. Excellent oral and written communication skills are required, including the ability to communicate clearly and succinctly required. Strong organization and presentation skills required. Excellent planning and execution, with attention to detail; ability to support multiple projects simultaneously is required. Proven experience using SQL required. An understanding of business terms, business processes, and data systems required. Ability to perform statistical analysis using Excel or similar applications required. Experience working with Salesforce preferred. The Data Analyst, CSB is expected to work with and support the demand for data and information by business users, business analysts, and decision makers. As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for collaborating with leadership to identify data analytics opportunities, and to design, develop and deliver reports, dashboards and analytical projects. You will design innovative analytic approaches to test hypotheses, extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data, and develop recommendations to drive business performance. You will be instrumental in leading the use of analytics as a critical value driver across our organization. Position Requirements Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university; or ten (10) years of progressive experience with the implementation, operation, programming and development of data and business intelligence solutions, or an equivalent in a related field, or the equivalent combination of training, education and experience. Experience in the application of statistical methods, mathematical techniques, forecasting, cost-benefit analysis, related analytical tools and programming languages. Extensive experience in problem resolution including determining root cause, scope and scale of issues. Experience working in an Agile development and project management environment. Advanced skill interpreting, extrapolating, interpolating data and SQL skills. Understanding and communicating data presented in models, charts, and tables and transforming it into a format that is useful to the business and aids effective decision making. Knowledge of various data structures and the ability to manipulate data within visualization tools such as Tableau, Oracle BI, or Microsoft Power BI. Data warehousing, data cleaning, and other analytical techniques required for data usage. Effective skill in the use of measurement and statistical practices to analyze current and historical data to make predictions, identify risks, and opportunities enabling better decisions on planned/future events. Knowledge of the process of sourcing raw data and cleansing techniques. Compensation and job title is commensurate with experience under the following pay ranges: Data Analyst I: $71,458 to $107,187 Data Analyst II: $79,496 to $119,244 Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. Northrop Grumman Federal Credit Union considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer. We offer a competitive total rewards package including a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits. Join us on the journey to get to net zero  At Carbon Direct, we dedicate our scientific, software, and business expertise to empower organizations around the world to take climate action.  Our Mission Enable organizations to reduce, remove, and utilize their emissions with carbon science We are a purpose-driven carbon management firm dedicated to helping organizations around the world reach their climate goals. We make carbon science accessible and actionable with our end-to-end platform.  Global citizens with global impact Whether a scientist, developer, or carbon markets expert, we are united by our mission to take climate action now. We are experts in our fields and we act with confidence. Located across 4 countries and 10+ states in the U.S., we offer both remote-friendly work options and dynamic, in-person experiences with offices located in Seattle, WA and Oakland, CA.  Diverse backgrounds bring diverse perspectives We recognize that teams with diverse backgrounds and different experiences are powerful. Bringing together a variety of perspectives only enhances how we can effectively address the climate crisis. Together, we are creating an environment where everyone is celebrated and anyone can succeed.  Overview  We are seeking an analyst to primarily help calculate carbon footprints for clients, in line with existing standards and protocols. Ideally, the analyst will identify opportunities to improve existing data models that can be incorporated into our core product offering. We want somebody who is adept at leveraging machine learning to identify reduction opportunities, compare outcomes against industry averages, and guide product development. While the role will be initially focused on carbon measurement, we are seeking a motivated analyst who wants to expand into other parts of the business, and is also able to manage bespoke client data problems. The role will require close collaboration with multiple teams within Carbon Direct (especially science, product, technology, and customer success). Responsibilities Calculate and analyze carbon footprints. Work with the product team on automation Monitor and stay updated on carbon measurement standards and protocols. Compare carbon footprints against industry averages to identify areas for improvement. Manage and solve unique data-related issues for our clients. Visualize data findings using tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Data Studio, presenting complex data in a way that is easy to understand. Use data to help drive decisions and strategies for reducing carbon footprints. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data analysis, machine learning, and carbon measurement. Qualifications Strong experience using SQL Basic proficiency in Python and familiarity working with Jupyter Notebooks. Some familiarity with R is a plus. Familiarity with Python’s most common data libraries (e.g Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn) Some proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, and/or Data Studio Basic familiarity with machine learning and LLM models, with an interest in learning more Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Experience and/or interest in carbon measurement is helpful. Ability to work cross-functionally and collaboratively with a team. Passion for solving climate problems and a keen interest in sustainability. Benefits  While we love our work, our lives aren’t defined by it. At Carbon Direct, we offer a robust benefits package that considers the whole person, their partners, and their families – and we’re always looking to improve.  Our U.S. benefits* include: Comprehensive nationwide medical, dental, and vision coverage. See a preview of our coverage here. Time off as needed: Flexible vacation policy and ten company-wide holidays, plus annual winter break between Christmas and New Year's 16 weeks of fully paid parental and family leave with no tenure requirement Remote-friendly work culture with annual company-wide retreats Reimbursement for your work-from-home setup and monthly work-from-home stipend  Please note that the benefits described apply to U.S.-based employees only. For our international employees, our benefits package varies by each country and its statutory requirements.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Carbon Direct is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other occupationally irrelevant criteria. We adhere rigorously to our equal employment opportunity policies in connection with all employment decisions, including hiring, compensation and promotion. Company Overview: Priority Inc is a well-established leader in the signage and branding space. We implement signage and graphics to bring customer brands to life. We take great pride in our collaborative, teamwork culture and look for candidates that are anxious to learn and contribute to the organization's growth and success. Our Vision is to be the world's most trusted, sought-after partner for the implementation of impactful branded environments as judged by clients, team members, and suppliers. Description The position of Data Specialist's primary responsibility is the management and transfer of data from source documentation to relevant ERP software platforms (DGP, ProjectPilot, etc). Applicants must have a strong understanding of Google Sheets and EXCEL. Along with the transfer of data, reviewing for deficiencies or errors are key to the position, as well as the ability to accurately verify the output. The position will mostly interface with our Business Analyst and Sourcing Manager in assisting with their data-related responsibilities, but the applicant will work across numerous departments as needed. Requirements Excellent attention to detail Ability to multitask effectively Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to perform repetitive tasks with a high degree of accuracy Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision High Proficiency with Google Sheets & EXCEL GSuite Application Skills MySQL / SQL Skills a plus but not required Duties Marketplace storefront maintenance Internal company knowledgebase website maintenance (Google Site) Custom reporting/form creation Update and distribute Weekly/Monthly reporting Standard Pricing maintenance across various systems Support other departments as needed  Physical Demands and Work Environment: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; Ability to work extra hours as needed to meet deadlines; Ability to travel responsibly; Sitting for extended periods of time; Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard and mouse; Physical ability to participate in training sessions, presentations, and meetings. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. Your role will involve actively soliciting and producing analytics projects, demonstrating the value of the C-Shopper Customer Insights Portal to both Users and internal Prospects, and providing training and help desk support. selected commercial projects Help define metrics for measuring program impact, customer satisfaction, product usage, and user group growth/productivity Ensure successful implementation and onboarding and business intelligence Strong understanding of data analysis techniques and tools Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams SEEKOPS POSITION SPECIFICATION Data Analyst II  The Organization  SeekOps Inc. develops and deploys advanced sensor technology for the energy sector to detect, localize, and quantify methane emissions through integrated drone-based systems. SeekOps’ unique sensor design eliminates false positive readings and localizes emissions sources to provide actionable data to oil and gas, and biogas and landfill operators in North and South America, Europe, the Middle East, and Africa, and Asia and Oceania. Backed by funding from the Oil and Gas Climate Initiative Climate Investments (OGCI-CI), Equinor Technology Ventures (ETV), Schlumberger and Caterpillar Ventures, SeekOps provides best-in-class technology to meet increasingly stringent environmental, sustainability and governance (ESG) reporting requirements, and enables customers worldwide to realize their goal of reducing methane intensity from operations.  More information about the company can be found at www.seekops.com.  The Position  This data analyst II reports to the data analytics manager and is responsible for gaining familiarity with all aspects of the technology and field operations at SeekOps. This role collects and manages data locally and, in the cloud, works with Python to assist in data ingestion, manages the tasks of junior data analyst where guided by solutions engineerand more as outlined below.  Job Responsibilities  Collect and manage data locally and in the cloud via SharePoint Input and QA data, mark for repair where not meeting current requirements and use prebuilt Python algorithms to automatically correct according to established protocols Diagnose data ingestion issues as part of data QA process Manipulate Python to assist in data ingestion and retrieval (Stack, Overflow, GitHub) Continuously improve automation and processing time Generate reports with data analyst I/II and data analytics manager and proofread final customer reports Consistently translate data into new insights to provide information to the director of operations Attend customer meetings to understand specific job requirements Continuous improvement of day-to-day operations (Python ingestion, data correction methods and processes Manage tasks of junior data analyst where guided by solutions engineer Work with the data analytics manager in developing new commercial answer products and insights  Skills & Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in STEM related field or equivalent required At least 3+ years’ experience Excellent communication & interpersonal skills, ability to work with people at all levels, up and down and across organizations, internally and externally. Experienced Microsoft Office user, including Word, Excel, Teams and PowerPoint, SharePoint, Python, SQL, data visualization tools: ArcGIS, R. Detail oriented critical thinker  The main roles, duties, and responsibilities shown above are not exhaustive but should merely be regarded as a guide. The employee will be expected to conduct any reasonable activities according to the business at that time. Hitapps is a GameDev company specializing in two areas: Hybrid-casual & Casual (Puzzle/Brain Teasers). We have several successful products in both categories with a combined total of over 80 000 000 downloads, and we are currently featured in the top charts in the Games section. We adhere to principles of openness and transparency, and we are results-oriented while valuing work-life balance.  We are currently searching for a skilled Data Analyst whom we can confidently entrust with the analysis of our products. Responsibilities: Creating a predictive model for the LTV of company products; Evaluating the effectiveness of traffic acquisition campaigns for iOS/Android applications; Collecting and visualizing data for report generation; Conducting A/B tests and analyzing their results; Analyzing key product metrics; Conducting research and discovering new insights within the data. Why you? Minimum 3 years of work experience in the Gamedev industry; Understanding of marketing and gaming metrics (LTV, ROI, ROAS, ARPU, ARPPU); Experience with databases, proficient in SQL; Experience in using Python for data processing and analysis; Experience with BI tools (Tableau/Power BI/Data Studio/Redash); Strong knowledge of mathematical statistics and A/B testing methods. Why us? Official employment; High salary level; Medical insurance; 100% compensation for vacations, sick leave, and day-offs; Compensation for educational and sports activities; Work in a team without bureaucracy; Opportunity to influence processes within the department. We are Quadcode, a company that develops a SaaS trading platform for clients around the world. We are currently looking for an top-tier Data Analyst for an exciting new fintech venture. Our perfect candidate is proactive, overflowing with innovative ideas for product development, and adept at articulating the business impact of these ideas. This role will become an opportunity to be a crucial member of our product team, influencing pivotal decisions and driving product improvements. You will work closely with the business owner, with the potential to establish the product as a global sensation. Your primary focus will be on marketing and the analytical facets of our product. This position can be based in any of the following countries: Cyprus, Bulgaria, Georgia, Belarus, Hungary, Romania, Latvia, Moldova, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Armenia, Kyrgyzstan, Greece, or Serbia.  Tasks in the role Analyzing data, identifying areas for growth, and drawing conclusions; Creating scenarios and predicting future outcomes; Monitoring metrics in third-party services; Formulating and testing hypotheses, conducting A/B tests; Creating technical tasks and managing tasks with other departments in order to enrich our database with data from third-party services or internal microservices; Utilizing business intelligence tools such as Tableau and Superset to create and present data-driven marketing and product analysis reports; Setup behaviour and marketing analytics tracking in our web/app. Requirements Knowledge of basic mathematical statistics and data analysis methods; Experience working with relational databases, experience with Big Query; General understanding of web/app analytics processes, understanding of tracking web/app tracking, understanding of marketing data collection; Practical experience writing complex SQL queries and optimizing them; Experience working with data visualization systems (such as Tableau and Superset); Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Seaborn); Experience with A/B testing; Experience with Google Analytics/Appsflyer/Google Tag Manager/Firebase; English language proficiency at least at B2 level. Would be a plus Working with DAGs (systems for managing ETL processes such as Airflow, DBT); Knowing what an advertising account is; Working experience with advertising campaigns on large platforms such as Facebook, AdWords, Yandex Direct; Familiarity with GitLab. We offer Remote work model / Relocation opportunity to Cyprus after a trial period; Competitive remuneration; Professional courses: from Coursera to Harvard; Friendly, enjoyable and positive environment. Note: All applications will be treated with strict confidence. We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. #LI-DG1 #LI-Remote We are Quadcode, a company that develops a SaaS trading platform for clients around the world. Job Title: Micro-Tasker on Toloka Job Overview: We are seeking highly motivated individuals to join our team as Micro-Taskers on Toloka. As a Micro-Tasker, you will be responsible for completing small, quick tasks on the Toloka platform. These tasks may include image labeling, text categorization, data verification, sentiment analysis, and more. This is a flexible, remote position that allows you to work at your own pace and earn money based on the number of tasks completed. Responsibilities: - Access the Toloka platform and select available micro-tasks to complete. - Follow the instructions provided for each task accurately and efficiently. - Perform tasks such as image labeling, text categorization, data verification, sentiment analysis, and other similar activities. - Maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail while completing tasks. - Meet or exceed task completion targets and quality standards set by the task requester. - Communicate effectively with the task requester, if necessary, to clarify instructions or seek additional information. - Work independently and efficiently, managing your own time and prioritizing tasks effectively. - Report any technical issues or bugs encountered while working on the Toloka platform. Requirements: - Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow instructions accurately. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. - Good command of the English language, both written and spoken. - Reliable internet connection and access to a computer or smartphone. - Ability to work independently and manage your own time effectively. - Prior experience with micro-tasking platforms like Toloka is a plus but not required. Benefits: - Flexible working hours: You can work anytime, anywhere, as long as there are available tasks. - Work from home: This is a remote position that allows you to work from the comfort of your own home. - Competitive pay: You will be compensated based on the number of tasks completed. - Skill development: Micro-tasking on Toloka provides an opportunity to develop and enhance your analytical and problem-solving skills. - Opportunity for growth: Exceptional performers may have the opportunity to take on more complex tasks or even become task reviewers in the future. If you are detail-oriented, enjoy working independently, and want to earn money by completing small, quick tasks, then this role as a Micro-Tasker on Toloka is perfect for you. Apply now and join our team! Job Type: Contract Pay: From $7.00 per hour Experience level: No experience needed No experience needed Schedule: Monday to Friday Monday to Friday Work Location: Remote

Description: Key Process Partners (KPP) is seeking a data analyst to help our clients with their data and reporting projects and tasks. KPP is a consulting company that helps companies reach their ambitious growth goals by improving their internal processes. We do this primarily through creating structure and operational processes to streamline their organization so they can grow and scale efficiently. KPP is looking to hire someone with experience using UiPath (RPA robotic process automation software). We will be making data updates for clients who are using PestPac software on a project-by-project basis, and are looking to automate the data updates using UiPath. Our ideal candidate also has advanced skills in Microsoft Excel so they can also assist on a recurring (monthly) basis with clients’ routine reporting needs. The pay range for this position is $50-$75 per hour. The position is 100% remote (work from anywhere). This is a part-time position as a W-2 employee (not a 1099 contractor), between 0 and 10 hours per week (5-25 hours per month). Depending on the project schedules and the volume of clients being supported, some weeks there may be 10+ hours of work and other weeks may have 0-2 hours of work. This role would be great for someone who is looking for part-time work with a flexible schedule. Your role would have responsibilities that are both project-based (as needed) and routine/recurring. Most of the work can be completed at any time (during traditional work hours or outside of traditional work hours), though most of the project work would need to be completed on weekends to avoid end-user interruption.  Job Duties would include: Perform large data updates using UiPath (robotic process automation software) (5-20 hours per month) Review data sets in Microsoft Excel such as customer revenue, employee hours worked, customer demographics, marketing KPIs, financial/accounting records, etc. and create Pivot Tables, dashboards, and other reporting for management review (1-2 hours per week) Create custom reports (including logic and formulas) and dashboards using Exago software (2-4 hours per month) Review data sets to look for trends or other variances (1-2 hours per month) Our ideal candidate has advanced skills in logic, math, formulas, and Microsoft Excel. You are very analytical-you like solving puzzles and looking for not just any solution but the most efficient solution. You like optimizing processes and making the overall experience better for all those involved.  Key Process Partners helps clients with their internal business processes to help them grow and scale their business to reach their ambitious growth goals. KPP has a mission to create wealth for women and minorities, and we especially love working with clients who are women-owned businesses or minority-owned businesses, and/or those that support our values of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging. Benefits: Flexible work schedule Direct Deposit Pay day on the 7th and 22nd of the month Paylocity payroll system Hiring Process: Phone Interview (10-15 minutes) Virtual Interview (60 minutes) Candidate personality assessments (online) Demonstration of skills competencies via Video Call/screenshare (30-60 minutes) Job Offer Background check Reference checks Requirements: Availability to work on weekends (Saturday or Sunday) Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including Pivot Tables and complex formulas (Nested if statements, multi-criteria conditional formatting, etc.) required 2+ years’ experience with UiPath (https://www.UiPath.com/) required 2+ years’ experience with Exago (https://insightsoftware.com/logi-analytics/) preferred 2+ years’ experience with PestPac Report Writer (https://www.pestpac.com/) preferred Key Process Partners (KPP) is seeking a data analyst to help our clients with their data and reporting projects and tasks. Job Title: Data Analyst Job Title: Data Analyst Reports To: Sr. Director of IT Reports To: Sr. Director of IT Office Location: Pleasant Hill, CA Office Location: Pleasant Hill, CA FLSA: Hourly, full-time, Non-Exempt - benefits eligible FLSA: Hourly, full-time, Non-Exempt - benefits eligible Special Olympics Northern California's (SONC) mission is to create an inclusive community where people with and without disabilities can make connections, develop healthy lifestyles, achieve success, and experience the joy of sports. Position Summary: Position Summary: ** We are interested in every qualified candidate eligible to work in the United States, but are not able to sponsor visas at this time ** ** We are interested in every qualified candidate eligible to work in the United States, but are not able to sponsor visas at this time ** As the organization’s first Data Analyst, this person will be responsible for creating a culture of shared and useful data across the organization. Special Olympics Northern California needs include the gathering, analyzing, aggregating, and reporting on data across the entire CRM Environment. Senior leadership will rely on this position to extract meaningful data-driven insights and present findings to them for use in helping solve key business problems. The position will be tasked with working with staff across multiple departments to create and maintain reporting and dashboards within the organization’s systems including Salesforce, Blackbaud Financial Edge, Microsoft O365, Google Sheets, UpMetrics, and peer-to-peer fundraising tools. This position must be able to use the organization’s existing tools and systems to help advance us toward a data-centric organization. Responsibilities/ Essential Functions: Responsibilities/ Essential Functions: Responsible for leading the analysis (including collection and cleaning) of data across the Special Olympics Northern CA data landscape. Maintaining data systems and databases; this includes identifying and fixing errors and other data-related issues. Mining data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing said data in a format that can be easily understood. Managing and analyzing qualitative and quantitative metrics to measure progress across key strategic areas. Work in conjunction with the Sr. Director of IT and a Salesforce database manager to create appropriate scope and procedures for data capture in all areas of the organization. Work in conjunction with IT Sr. Director to ensure continued data quality. Helping staff interpret data with attention to trends and patterns that may be valuable for future organizational efforts. Developing reports for leadership that effectively communicates trends, patterns, and predictions. Collaborating with department heads to identify opportunities for improvement, recommend modifications, and develop guidelines for data governance. Help managers to understand and craft metrics, track approaches, and answer their questions. Occasionally presenting to management the “state of data” in the organization. Creating a documentation and reporting structure for the organization. Other needs as identified. LOCATION: Remote What are we doing at Uscreen? Uscreen is a growing (and profitable) bootstrapped product-led SaaS business revolutionizing the way that video-based entrepreneurs & creators monetize their content. Uscreen provides an all-in-one video membership platform. We empower video-based entrepreneurs to monetize subscriptions, communities, courses, and live-streamed events across platforms (web, mobile, & TV). 25,000+ video creators sell, market, manage, & grow their businesses with Uscreen — and they generate hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue doing it.  As a Data Analyst, you will be an integral part of our Analytics team. This is a unique experience in that you’ll drive key insights into the actionable metrics that help our customers build stronger membership businesses. As such, you’ll partner closely with leaders on our Customer Success and Product Marketing teams to help our customers get the most out of our platform. You’ll excel in this role if you’re comfortable with communication, enjoy experimentation, have strong attention to detail, and are excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally. You’ll be joining a growing and versatile Analytics team, so we’re looking for teammates eager to explore new areas and support different parts of our company as our team priorities and contributions to the business evolve. What you’ll do Analyze user data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can help us improve user retention and support Develop dashboards and reports that provide insights into key performance metrics on the health of our customers’ businesses Collaborate with Product Marketing on building a better understanding of our customer segments and understanding the needs of the growth creators that our product supports Effectively and clearly present findings and recommendations to both senior company stakeholders and customers, and provide guidance on how to leverage data to drive business growth Do you have what it takes? Post-secondary degree in a relevant field such as: Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science 3+ years of experience in data analytics, preferably in a customer-facing role Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis, data visualization, and reporting Experience with analyzing complex datasets using SQL Experience with data storytelling and building dashboards on business intelligence platforms such as Metabase or Looker Familiarity with our Analytics tech stack (dbt, BigQuery, Metabase) a plus Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders including Uscreen customers Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail ✔️ Are you interested in applying? These files need to be received and converted into a usable, searchable database for analytics purposes by Medicaid/HHSC programs, into the OMOP EHR database architecture. Without such a database, the real-time files will not work for the numerous use cases that are being developed. The two forms of clinical data being sent to HHSC, as part of the Health Information Exchange (HIE) Connectivity Project, are Admission, Discharge, Transfer (ADT) messages and Consolidated Clinical Document Architecture (C-CDA). This data is delivered to HHSC in individual .xml and .csv files and is currently coming through a single source. These files need to be received and converted into a usable, searchable OMOP database for analytics purposes by Medicaid/HHSC programs. Without such a database, the real-time files will not work for the numerous use cases that are being developed. Vendor focus for candidates: Strong SQL experience Medicaid or Public Health experience Good understanding of HL7 V2 and V3 data structures OMAP knowledge/experience: The Observational Medical Outcomes Partnership (OMOP) CDM model for Electronic Health Records (HER) Azure cloud development platform experience Corepoint or Rhapsody experience Python experience ETL experience (Informatica preferred) II. Our Mission and Opportunity Early education is one of the greatest determinants of childhood outcomes, is a must for working families, and has a lasting social and economic impact. Brightwheel’s vision is to enable high quality early education for every child — by giving teachers meaningfully more time with students each day, engaging parents in the development of their kids, and supporting the small businesses that make up the backbone of the $175 billion early education market. Brightwheel is the most loved technology brand in early education globally, trusted by thousands of educators and millions of families.  Our Team We are a fully remote team with employees across every time zone in the US. Our team is passionate, talented, and customer-focused. Our exceptional investor group includes Addition, Bessemer Venture Partners, Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, GGV Capital, Lowercase Capital, Emerson Collective, and Mark Cuban.  We believe that everyone—from our employees to the students, teachers, and administrators we serve— should be given the opportunity to learn and thrive, whatever their background may be. We celebrate diversity in all forms because it allows our team and the communities we serve to reach their full potential and do their best work.  Who You Are Brightwheel is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join the Analytics team. We are looking for a world-class problem solver and a highly structured thinker who can break down and solve any challenge using data. This person will answer high-priority, targeted business questions to drive growth and support day-to-day reporting needed across the business - including Product, Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and more. Additionally, this person will work closely with our Data & Analytics Engineering team on building and improving the operational data sets that power our analytics and operational workflows.  The ideal candidate has a strong bias towards action, enjoys finding patterns amidst chaos, and has repeatedly demonstrated success using analytics to drive impact. In addition, we are looking for someone with the technical skills to surface insights quickly and the communication skills to translate those insights in a way that persuades action.  What You’ll Do Use quantitative data analysis across multiple data sources to provide insights to help business and product leaders understand critical business questions - including identifying and quantifying the key levers that impact the business Identify analyses and key metrics to drive and inform our GTM strategy and track progress against company initiatives Report against company initiatives by identifying key metrics and building executive-facing dashboards to track progress across the business, including areas like Marketing, Sales, Product, and Customer Success Build scaled analytical solutions for the business partnering closely with Data Engineering to simultaneously ensure sustainable sources in the data warehouse Partner closely with your internal customers to intake, prioritize and deliver against new report requests and analysis/business questions Collaborate with cross-functional operational teams to drive continuous data discovery and usage  Qualifications, Skills, & Abilities 2-4 years experience in data analytics, FP&A, or another relevant technical role, or 1-2 yrs of analyst experience paired with 1-2 years of consulting or other directly relevant experience Highly proficient in SQL with working knowledge of optimizing and debugging complex queries (Preferred: ETL experience) Proficiency in one or more analytics visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Mode). Must have experience deriving insights from complex data and dealing with relational databases Working knowledge of data engineering principles: understanding how to store, manage, & retrieve large-scale data sets from multiple systems for analysis or operations Demonstrated ability to be a trusted & respected business partner to all levels in the organization, and the ability to translate data into clear, actionable next steps for internal teams Ownership mindset: Must be able to initiate, prioritize and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance Experience with our most relevant tools a plus (Redshift, Tableau, Salesforce, Hubspot, Fivetran, Airflow) Experience designing A/B tests and interpreting results a plus  Brightwheel is committed to internal pay equity and offers a competitive compensation package, including base salary, equity, and benefits. Our benefits package includes premium medical, dental, and vision benefits, generous paid parental leave, a flexible paid time off policy, a monthly wellness and productivity stipend, and a Learning & Development stipend.  For cash compensation, brightwheel sets standard ranges for all roles based on function, level, and geographic location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Multiple factors determine final offer amounts, including geographic location, candidate experience, and expertise. If you have questions about the compensation band for your region, please ask your recruiter.  Brightwheel is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Job Summary: The primary role of this position is to lead and manage the data conversion process of newly acquired firms. As the need arises, this role may assist other members of the Operations team with other functions such as product management, support and training. Primary Responsibilities and Duties: The duties of the Jr. Business Data Analyst include but are not limited to: Managing the data conversion process of newly acquired firms Independently determining the correct end-state mappings of data being converted from source systems Understanding the data and workflow needs of the business and how to translate the data in order to meet those needs Leading information gathering conversion calls to obtain the data needed to achieve successful conversions Requirements and Qualifications: College degree preferred Proficient in Microsoft Excel Prior analytical experience Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills Desire to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment Ability to operate in US time zones Physical Demands and Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to regularly sit, hear, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. The work environment characteristics described are representative of those employees performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud. Some travel may be required (up to 25%). Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnect from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products. Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo. We are growing fast and need people that want to be part of the journey, commercializing Sensing as a Service and enabling “Intelligence for Everyday Thing”. This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in tactical data exploration through statistical models and to deliver business and performance insights. You will sift through massive amounts of data to discover “Ah ha!” moments for key retail customers that connect the dots between our technology and their key problems. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in statistical analysis, data visualization, as well as experience working with large, complex data sets. You will work with internal teams, and key customer teams to turn these insights into integrated solutions. Creativity, curiosity, and resilience are key for this role as you often won’t know what we’re looking for until we’ve found it.  Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Math, CS, data science/engineering or equivalent analytical degree 1-2 years of professional experience Visualization tools experience including UI design (Tableau, PowerBI, Plotly, Grafana) Strong Python Understanding of statistical analysis and relational database structures (SQL, Databricks a plus) Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving abilities Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Experience with IoT data streams and business context Ability to be-self-sufficient and execute quickly when given autonomy Flexible team player who will thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving environment  Responsibilities: Work hands-on in the data using SQL, PySpark, and other tools to extract, analyze, and visualize data. Work with experts throughout the company to figure out the right questions to ask in order to uncover new problems and solutions. Take complicated concepts, systems, and processes and clearly communicate what matters to stakeholders. Write and share the results of your impact estimations and project evaluations Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnect from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products. Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo. Creativity, curiosity, and resilience are key for this role as you often won’t know what we’re looking for until we’ve found it. Recall Masters is the leading provider of automotive recall information, services, and vehicle owner communications dedicated to helping automakers and their franchise dealers expedite the repair of recalled vehicles and make the roadways safer for everyone. We have partnered with 17 of the top 25 National Dealer Groups, including all the Publics. Recall Masters is looking for a highly organized and results-oriented individual to work as a Performance Manager. The ideal candidate works well with multiple teams within a fast-paced organization and possesses the ability to navigate through various client contacts. In addition to a great compensation plan including benefits, RM offers a collaborative and fun culture where talent thrives and career growth is nearly unlimited. If you're looking to start your career as a data analyst, this junior position is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience and develop your analytical skills. You will work closely with senior data analysts and the production team to collect, organize, and analyze data to support business operations. This is an in-person position at our office in Laguna Hills, CA. Primary Responsibilities R+ data/art merge Assist Data team with workload and any special assignments Training on data process Monthly ROI reporting Custom ROI reporting Additional Duties/Responsibilities: Assist with designs and implements secure, efficient, and accurate databases. Ensures that database projects are completed on time and within estimated costs. Assists Data Analyst Team Lead and identifies and resolves production and/or applications development problems related to the use of the database management system software or utilities. Gathers, organizes, and interprets statistical data from the database to provide reports to, and answer questions from, upper management. Other duties assigned by supervisor. Quality checks all guidelines via Zendesk/emails to ensure accuracy prior to delivery. Proficient use of Company CRM (Salesforce) and complete trackers.    Job Requirements:  Minimum Qualifications Assists Database Analyst Team Lead and identifies and resolves production and/or applications development problems related to the use of the database management system software or utilities. Gathers, organizes, and interprets statistical data from the database to provide reports to, and answer questions from, upper management.  Preferred Qualifications Associate degree in business administration, Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, or Computer Science or equivalent work experience required. At least one to two years in Data Processing, with at least two years of experience with database management systems; OR two years as a development programmer/analyst using database techniques under IMS/DB-DL/1 required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Understanding of computer languages used within database. Understanding of database design and construction.  Other Requirements This role leverages a flex-schedule that may involve nontraditional working hours. Must be able to work from the Recall Masters office or remotely from a home office, depending on the candidate’s skills and experience. This position is eligible to US citizens physically residing in the US, any offer of employment is contingent upon background, drug screen, and reference checks. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified. AG Grace is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. The Data Analyst will collect and analyze data across the customer?s mission space to make informed decisions. Data will involve structured and unstructured data from information advantage activities in support of multi-domain operations. Work is performed in a hybrid role with some on customer site support. Essential Job Responsibilities Regular activities consist of interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing reports. Develop and implement data exploration techniques, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize data efficiency and quality. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization, including data sources, security, and metadata. Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing. Demonstrated ability to work well independently with little input, and as a part of a team. Other duties as assigned. AG Grace is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. Role Overview: As a Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in analyzing manufacturing data, uncovering meaningful patterns, and transforming raw data into actionable insights. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including operations, supply chain, finance, and Sales, you will use the Azure platform and Power BI to develop interactive dashboards and reports that facilitate data-driven decision-making. Role Overview: Responsibilities: Responsibilities: Gain a deep understanding of our manufacturing operations, data sources, and business objectives. Design and implement robust data models ensure accurate and reliable data analysis. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and establish data collection methodologies aligned with manufacturing goals. Acquire, clean, and transform complex datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the process. Utilize statistical methods and data mining techniques to analyze manufacturing data, identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights. Develop interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports using Power BI, providing stakeholders with real-time access to critical information. Generate regular reports and deliver data-driven presentations to communicate findings and recommendations effectively. Collaborate with IS team to maintain and optimize the data infrastructure and systems on the Azure platform, ensuring data availability, security, and scalability. Stay updated on industry best practices, advancements in data analytics, Azure platform capabilities, and Power BI features to drive continuous improvement and innovation. Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing analytical support and expertise to address specific operational challenges or strategic initiatives. Generate regular reports and deliver data-driven presentations to communicate findings and recommendations effectively. Collaborate with IS team to maintain and optimize the data infrastructure and systems on the Azure platform, ensuring data availability, security, and scalability. Stay updated on industry best practices, advancements in data analytics, Azure platform capabilities, and Power BI features to drive continuous improvement and innovation. Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing analytical support and expertise to address specific operational challenges or strategic initiatives. Qualifications: Bachelor's or Masters degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or Engineering. A master's degree is a plus. Qualifications: Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within a manufacturing or industrial environment. Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis. Experience in designing and implementing data models, ETL processes, and data integration workflows. Proficient in developing interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI. Familiarity with Azure services, including Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, Azure ML, and Azure Data Factory. Solid understanding of statistical analysis techniques and machine learning algorithms. Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and data visualization skills. Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner. Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities. Familiarity with Azure services, including Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, Azure ML, and Azure Data Factory. Solid understanding of statistical analysis techniques and machine learning algorithms. Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and data visualization skills. Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner. Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities. If you are passionate about harnessing the power of data to optimize manufacturing processes and contribute to our organization's success, we encourage you to apply for the position of Data Analyst. Join our team and be part of a dynamic and innovative manufacturing company that values data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement. Class Definition GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES: To be responsible for conducting full lifecycle activities of data analytics to include requirements and design, data cleaning, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, linking databases and datasets, and continuously monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements in models; and to do related work as required.  SUPERVISION RECEIVED: Works under the general supervision of a superior with some latitude for the exercise of independent judgement and initiative. Work is subject to review for conformance with prescribed state policies and procedures.  SUPERVISION EXERCISED: As assigned, coordinates and reviews the work of subordinates; reviews work in progress and upon completion for adequacy, propriety, technical sufficiency, and conformity with instructions. Illustrative Examples of Work Performed To be responsible for conducting full lifecycle activities of data analytics to include requirements and design, data cleaning, developing analysis and reporting capabilities, linking databases and datasets, and continuously monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements in models.  To assure the integrity of project data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis.  To query and interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, develop predictive models using administrative datasets and provide ongoing reports.  To acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.  To provide data visualization and presentation of analytical findings to program owners and other stakeholders.  To identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets.  To link databases and datasets to generate integrated datasets.  To filter and "clean" data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.  To participate in ongoing decisions concerning data collections, study design, methodology, and data analysis.  To locate and define new process improvement opportunities.  To do related work as required. Required Qualifications for Appointment KNOWLEDGES, SKILLS AND CAPACITIES: A thorough knowledge of data models, regression analysis, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques; a thorough knowledge of sophisticated reporting packages, databases and programming; a working knowledge of statistical methodologies and techniques utilized for analyzing large datasets; the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy; the ability to conduct queries, draw conclusions, prepare written reports and present findings in a clear and concise manner; the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with state and municipal officials, superiors, subordinates and the public; and related capacities and abilities.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Education: Such as may have been gained through: graduation from a four-year college of recognized standing with a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a closely related field with similar technical and computational emphasis; and Experience: Such as may have been gained through: employment in a professional capacity as a data analyst or in a technical capacity involving computational emphasis or data analysis. Or, any combination of education and experience that shall be substantially equivalent to the above education and experience. Supplemental Information Experience with VUEWorks and Microsoft Office Suite coupled with highway maintenance knowledge strongly preferred. Experience in a professional capacity as a data analyst or in a technical capacity involving computational emphasis or analysis desired. Job Description The candidate will deliver strategic insight to DHB management by competently leveraging data analysis techniques, sophisticated technology tools, and information management principles to help our stakeholders make well-informed decisions. The position will have direct client contact and be tasked to identify, query, and analyze complex data to interpret trends or patterns and to advise and assist DHB business partners in drawing supportable conclusions and developing actionable recommendations. The candidate is expected to work without assistance; can provide leadership to others; able to manage highly complex work efforts; adeptly reflect complex technical specifications accurately in developed SAS/SQL code; may have advanced education; has extensive related industry experience. The candidate will report to a Business Information & Analytics Manager. Description of expected competencies (including, but not limited to): 1. Technical expertise and work experience in SAS, SQL (required) SAS, SQL (required) Tableau (preferred) Tableau (preferred) Cognos (preferred) and Cognos (preferred) and data quality control (required ). data quality control (required ). 2. Specialization in providing solutions for healthcare data management to propose and implement operational reporting that improves executive decision making and provides analytical capabilities for the client. 3. Data aggregation, analysis, and reporting experience using Medicaid Management Information systems (MMIS), Medicaid or Commercial Health Care administrative claims and encounters, provider and eligibility data, or other large and complex Health Care data sources. 4. Understanding of healthcare management to prepare operational reporting and/or performance dashboards to improve decision making and provide analytical insight for the division. 5. Ability to work with division staff to assess and understand reporting needs; design, develop and execute appropriate solutions. Perform statistical analysis to explore and solve complex business problems. 6. Experience using technical specifications to develop reports and advanced analytics for state and national healthcare utilization, standards of care and quality of care measures and program oversight. 7.
