Foxconn Wisconsin is seeking for a Data Analyst to support our Business Intelligence and Digitization group. We are seeking individuals who enjoy the challenge of performing in a start-up environment and have a desire to revolutionize a whole new industry. Once a part of the team, you will be responsible for a wide variety of tasks within the manufacturing department in a production environment and have the opportunity to display critical thinking skills to expand your career in Smart Manufacturing. The Data Analyst will be responsible for the full stack of data analytics, from querying or procuring data, cleaning data, feature generation, problem formulation, error/success metric choice, machine learning/predictive model building, and translation of results into business action. This role will help Foxconn’s data strategy within manufacturing, and data-related business decision making. Job Responsibilities Include: Act as a cross functional consultant on data science, data analytics related efforts that span the Foxconn enterprise. Identify appropriate analytical tools and methods; use advanced knowledge of business analysis to perform quantitative analyses and predictive modeling. Be able to communicate and explain the results of more technical analyses to business partners in a digestible, visual fashion. Lead strategy development for data and analytics products to ensure the program becomes pervasive throughout the organization. Develop a high performing team focused on building strong analytical, data strategy, research and business skill sets while sustaining leading employee engagement and retention. Be a stakeholder in developing and maturing the Data Science strategy. Deliver solutions according to the delivery schedule. Design and architect complete end-to-end DS solutions. Continuous improvement on predictive and machine learning models. Conform to industry standards for quality and effective data visualization and reporting. Other Duties as assigned. Education Requirements and Ideal Experience Includes: Bachelor’s degree in Business Analysis, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field. 3+ years of experience in a data driven role with Manufacturing/Engineering environment a plus. Experienced with Data Science/Statistics/ML practices and tools, such as R, Python. Familiar with 3PL business and supply chain concepts Experience with ETL design and data warehousing concepts 1+ years with reporting / visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, R-Shiny or Plotly-Dash Experience with Oracle, MySQL and/or MS SQL Server and SQL query language required Experience with common Statistical Process Control Analysis in Manufacture. Knowledge of software tools necessary to manage projects. Ability to manage aggressive timelines and adapt to change. Critical thinking skills with strong business acumen and consideration. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills both verbal and written for sharing ideas with other departments and the customer. Advanced computer skills utilizing Office 365: Word, Excel, Teams, SharePoint, Project, PowerPoint Reasons you should work at Foxconn Wisconsin & FII USA, Inc: Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage. Basic life insurance and short-term disability coverage provided by employer. Supplemental life insurance and long-term disability coverage options available. 401K with employer contribution. Personal, Vacation, and Holiday paid time off for all full-time employees. On-site clinic available for all employees. Employees are continuously encouraged to learn and grow their careers in smart manufacturing. Overview: Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, resulting in increased access to educational funding and improved outcomes. The Meritize platform promotes the growth and development of skills-based careers on behalf of students, educators and employers through innovative funding solutions, skills building programs and career success services. Responsibilities: If you are looking to work alongside a team of highly energetic, passionate and driven people, then this opportunity may be for you. onsemi (Nasdaq: ON) is driving disruptive innovations to help build a better future. With a focus on automotive and industrial end-markets, the company is accelerating change in megatrends such as vehicle electrification and safety, sustainable energy grids, industrial automation, and 5G and cloud infrastructure. With a highly differentiated and innovative product portfolio, onsemi creates intelligent power and sensing technologies that solve the world’s most complex challenges and leads the way in creating a safer, cleaner, and smarter world. onsemi is looking for an organized and resourceful individual who can help assist the Strategic Operations staff with the day-to-day data entry and ad-hoc data reporting needs. The Data Analyst is responsible for validating and structuring data required by various business process management tools, provide daily support to the project managers and assists in various continuous improvement initiatives. Job Responsibilities: Responsible for reviewing source data and final data outputs generated by the BI Tools Responsible for reconciling data reports and results for monthly and quarterly Business reviews Responsible for ensuring all entered data are accurate and complete Responsible for maintaining the Team’s data repositories and guiding end users such as Project Managers on data usage Responsible for curating specialized reports following the instructions of requesters using Excel, BI tools Responsible for analyzing requirements and translating them per target audience  Qualifications  Qualifications: 2+ years of experience in business analytics, data analytics, or related field Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems/Business Analytics, or equivalent experience. Semiconductor industry experience preferred. Technical skills: Hands-on experience in data analysis using BI Tools and programming languages such as Qlikview, Tableau, Python, R, SQL, and Power BI 1+ years of experience in developing, deploying, and maintaining Tableau reports is a must. Experience in working with large data sets using advanced Excel. Competency in Microsoft applications, including Excel, Teams, and Project Online, is a must. Familiarity with data retrieval from databases using SQL is a plus. Soft skills (Competencies): Familiarity with semiconductor products and business models is preferred. Effective communication (oral and written) skills, including problem-solving, prioritizing, and interpersonal relationship-building. Ability to work effectively as a team member across the operation and project teams and independently in a fast-paced environment.  #LI-Onsite  Equal Employment Opportunity onsemi is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. The Data Management Analyst assists in optimizing data so it can be used in a more efficient and accurate manner. Essential Functions Review and examine all pertinent databases to gain insights into financial and contractual data to determine trends and how these insights might improve the division Review and examine all pertinent databases to identify inaccurate or bad data and correct and/or remove it from the systems Continuously examine data entry methods to determine process improvements and process efficiencies Review existing databases to convert data into useable information so leadership can make decisions and improve operations Maintain data quality by checking the accuracy and integrity of data within the organization.  Education BS/BA or higher Experience 5 - 10 years’ experience Must be able to pass DHS Suitability The Data Management Analyst assists in optimizing data so it can be used in a more efficient and accurate manner. Elo is an industry leader in enterprise solutions, with a focus on Android computing, Android SDKs and Cloud Management Software. Our technology is used by leading big box retailers, healthcare, restaurants, and within the manufacturing industry. Elo products are installed every 21 seconds around the globe! We obsess over details to exceed the highest quality standards. We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges. What You Will Do: Support sales, operations, and financial reporting dashboards to provide insights into revenue, margin, financial performance, product analytics, sales funnel, rebates necessary. As a Technical Data Analyst, you will be expected to demonstrate superior problem-solving skills and logical thinking and serve as a subject matter expert for data analysis. This role is a blend of a data scientist and a traditional data analyst. Job Responsibilities: Perform data analysis and other general business analysis tasks Use of analytical tools, query, and scripting languages including Apply problem solving skills to understand and solve analytical problems Perform statistical analysis across disparate data sources Have the ability to diagnose problems with complex data flows Learn new skills, make timely decisions, and adapt well to change Position Requirements: 3-5+ years as a data analyst; any healthcare industry experience is a plus SQL proficiency and regular use in a professional setting is a must Demonstrated ability to solve problems and think logically and analytically Ability with dealing with complex data sets Ability to understand processes and workflows Strong communication skills Experience with analytical tools such as SQL, SPSS/R/SAS, Python, PowerBI/Tableau Experience with statistical methods such as hypothesis testing and regression analysis Familiarity with common machine learning techniques is a plus Experience with healthcare common data and quality standards, including: Messaging – HL7, FHIR, relevant EDI formats Data sources – EHRs, HIE, Plans Quality – HEDIS, CQMs APIs– REST, SOAP Microsoft Office experience: Excel (Deeper Knowledge Preferred), Word, PowerPoint, Visio. Education: Bachelor’s Degree (Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other analytical discipline) or equivalent experience Azara Healthcare offers a full suite of medical plans, 401(k) plan, 7 company & 3 floating holidays, 4 weeks of PTO and other benefits in addition to a competitive salary. Azara offers a full suite of medical plans, 401(k) plan, 10 company holidays, 4 weeks of PTO and other benefits in addition to a competitive salary. If you are interested in applying for any of the Azara career opportunities, please send a cover letter and resume to careers@azarahealthcare.com. Summary  The Data Analyst is responsible for supporting efforts to maintain and improve the current data warehouse environment as it relates to financials, operations, and sales. They will work in concert with Senior Leadership, FP&A, Ops, Sales and Analytics to support fact-based reporting and insights from the system of record, as well as have responsibilities tied to the monthly close process and value-added initiatives.  Education/Experience  Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Computer Science, and 0-1 years in an analyst or financial systems role.  Duties and Responsibilities  They include the following: other duties may be assigned as needed.  Will support the maintenance and administration of Apotheco’s data warehouse with a focus on front-end reporting. Go-to resource for the needs of the Finance and Operations Teams as they pertain to reporting from, changes to, and growth of the data warehouse. Work within the data warehouse to analyze and validate financial data and operational reporting. Work with a variety of data tools including SQL, Tableau, and Python to automate data workflows and build meaningful insights including data visualizations, standardized reports and dashboards, and ad-hoc analyses as needed. Research root causes and provide supporting details and presentations based on data insights. Analyze risks and opportunities of growth initiatives. Other jobs as required.  Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Language Ability:  Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.  Math Ability:  Ability to comprehend and apply principles of basic math while analyzing data and generating reports.  Reasoning Ability:  Ability to apply principles of logical and critical thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems.  Computer Skills:  To perform this job successfully, an individual should have experience with or knowledge of software products including SQL, Tableau, Python, Excel, and others as needed.  Information Security Expectations:  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to abide by Apotheco’s information security policies, employee handbook and security and privacy regulatory requirements. Each employee is responsible for the secure and appropriate handling of Apotheco’s information, information received by customers, other companies and/or external parties.  Knowledge, Skills, and Other Abilities  Self-motivated Analytical/critical thought processes, judgment, and decision-making Economic, accounting principles and practices, and the analysis and reporting of financial data Time management Oral and written communication Professionalism Organization Prioritization Detail-oriented Goal-oriented Dependable Work well with various personalities and within a team Participate in continuous quality improvement  Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to walk; sit and use hands. The employee is occasionally required to stand.
